src: Jerry remembers coming home from university that day, the police cars on his street, his parents telling him what had happened. Suzan was gone and it didn’t make sense how life could end so easily. That’s the balance, he realizes.
mt: 傑瑞還記得，那一天他從大學回家，看見街頭停著警車，他的父母告訴了他一切：蘇姍死了，生命如此脆弱，卻連一點兒預兆也沒有。

src: Her foot goes into the garden off to the side, she stumbles, holding onto the hockey stick to try and keep her balance, and suddenly he realizes what’s about to happen.
mt: 她的腳陷入花園草地，打了個趔趄，差點兒絆倒了。她抱著曲棍球棒想保持平衡，突然他意識到即將發生什麼，雖然她很煩人，但他不希望看到她摔在地上，弄破腦袋。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: He puts the knife on the edge of the desk and goes back to the hole. He closes his hand around some loose pages.
mt: 他把刀放在桌邊，回頭繼續摸索，他抓到了一些零散的紙片。
llm_reason: Core actions and sequence accurately conveyed.

src: When Mrs. Smith comes over later, just smile at her, and tell her how much fun you had ruining her pride and joy.
mt: 後來，史密斯太太來了，你沖她微笑，告訴她毀了她為之驕傲和喜悅的玫瑰是多麼有趣。

src: You found the spray can later that night.
mt: 就在那天晚上，你找到了噴漆。

src: He stands so suddenly that he knocks the table and tips over his glass of orange juice.
mt: 他停得太突然，撞到了餐桌，打翻了橙汁。

src: That was forgetting. He pushes away from the table and throws up on the floor, the vomit splashing and hitting his shoes.
mt: 他猛地推開桌子，衝著地板一陣嘔吐，穢物亂濺，弄到他的鞋上了。

src: “It’s your nosy neighbor,” he says.
mt: 「是你的八卦鄰居。」

src: “These people you think you killed, it just didn’t happen. Nobody in your street was murdered. You never snuck into anybody’s house and killed them.
mt: 你家的街道上沒有人被殺害，你也沒有溜進別人家殺害他們。

src: But then . . . how would . . . the timeline doesn’t . . .
mt: 但是之後……怎麼會……時間上也不對……

src: “The house was sold, Jerry. Nine months ago,” she says, staring ahead at the road.
mt: 「房子賣了，傑瑞，九個月前。」

src: It was really nice to just talk about something other than the insanity bomb waiting to detonate at some point in the future.
mt: 有事兒可談挺好的，總比等著某個隱秘的炸彈爆炸好。

src: He decides to give it a few minutes in case Hans calls back, which is exactly what happens.
mt: 他決定再等幾分鐘，等漢斯回撥過來。他真的回電了，他接起電話。
llm_reason: Accurately captures the sequence and intent.

src: Writing about her wasn’t enough, which is why you went over and ripped out every single rose in her garden, roses she was so proud of.
mt: 寫她還遠遠不夠，這就是你要毀掉她花園裡每一朵玫瑰花的緣故。那些玫瑰令她無比驕傲，她每天都會細心檢查一番。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with added context.

src: He sits on the edge of his bed and he rubs his eyes and stretches his legs and stretches his back and hears something click into place.
mt: 他坐在床邊，揉了揉眼睛，甩了甩腿，又伸了個懶腰。

src: “That’s not funny,” Jerry says, and it’s not funny, not funny, not funny, and it’s not true either, not true, and the silt is shifting, it’s shifting, and it can’t be true because he doesn’t even own a gun, and it’s like he’s been saying—he would feel it.
mt: 「這並不好笑。」傑瑞說，這並不好笑，不好笑，不好笑；這並不是真的，不是真的，不是真的。他根本就沒有槍，所以不可能是真的，就像他說的那樣，他能感覺到。

src: Jerry keeps rewinding the clock, going further back into the morning, but continually comes to a stop the moment he came to on that woman’s couch.
mt: 傑瑞在腦海中撥回指針，他回到了早上，回到在那個女人的沙發上的那一刻，他停了下來。

src: They knew as soon as they walked inside the house they could see themselves living their lives out there.
mt: 當他們走進房子，自然就會找到他們在這裏過完一生的印記。
llm_reason: Accurate literary translation with appropriate imagery.

src: It’s funny how she got under your skin so much, but she did, and not only have you helped her with her own garden, but you’ve put her into book number thirteen.
mt: 她要是激怒了你就太有趣了，不過她的確把你激怒了。你不僅成全了她的花園，還把她寫進第十三本書。

src: “He put it there.”
mt: 「是他弄上去的。」

src: She came over on Sunday morning and popped the news. She and What’s His Name got engaged on Saturday night.
mt: 她是星期天上午過來的，結婚的消息說得很突然，她說她和那個誰誰誰星期六晚上訂的婚。

src: His friend was switching off again, wasn’t he?
mt: 他的朋友腦子關機了，不是嗎？

src: Sandra will look after you—that’s what she’s promised, but these are the promises of a woman who has known for only eight hours that the man you are is going to fade away, to be replaced by a stranger.
mt: 好吧，夥計，沒有人會知道以後是什麼樣子。桑德拉會照顧你，她答應過的，但這都是女人的承諾，她知道像你這樣的男人生命會逐漸凋零，你的位置最終會被一個陌生人代替。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary translation.

src: It was Henry. Henry Cutter, writer of words, destroyer of lives.
mt: 亨利·卡特，一名作家，他是生命的毀滅者。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary tone.

src: “It’s not like I have experience at this kind of thing. This is why in movies the guys doing the holding look like bodybuilders.”
mt: 這就是為什麼在電影中做這種事的人看起來像是健美運動員。」

src: You were The Man Goes Burning from your ghostwritten book.
mt: 你是你的代筆寫的那本書里的「燃燒的男人」。
llm_reason: Accurate and literary translation of the phrase.

src: He is Henry Cutter.
mt: 他是亨利·卡特。

src: You’ve always been a gin-and-tonic guy, ever since we met.”
mt: 自從我們認識以來，你一直愛喝加奎寧水的杜松子酒。」

src: Nurse Hamilton puts a hand on his shoulder. “This isn’t your home anymore,” she says, and she sounds unhappy with the development.
mt: 漢密爾頓護士拍拍他的肩頭：「這裏不再是你的家了。」

src: Should I answer it?”
mt: 我要不要接？」

src: I’m not entirely sure,” he says, which sums up his life these days pretty well, he thinks.
mt: 他說。這話很好地總結了他這幾天的生活，他心想。

src: His thoughts and memories twisted and decayed.
mt: 隨後，他弄丟了自己，思維和記憶逐漸扭曲，殘缺不全。
llm_reason: Accurate and literary translation of decayed thoughts and memories.

src: He decides he doesn’t ever want to read any of his books ever again, because there’s something more than just the memory of coming home and finding the police cars. There’s something else hidden in the darkness—best he stops looking.
mt: 他也不想再讀他寫的其他書了，它們不僅會讓他回想起回家時看到街頭警車的畫面，還會勾起黑暗中潛藏著的其他記憶，還是別喚醒這些記憶。

src: I wish I could tell Sandra how sorry I am, but what’s done is done, it was done by me, and there’s no going back.
mt: 我希望能告訴桑德拉我很抱歉，但覆水難收，是我做的，沒有後悔葯可吃。

src: Mrs. Smith asks, and the he makes Jerry sound like he didn’t just shoot his wife, but ate her too.
mt: 史密斯太太問，那個「他」字在傑瑞聽來彷彿是他不僅開槍打死了妻子，還把她給吃了。

src: You put the barrel of the gun into your mouth and your teeth scraped against it and you didn’t like that feeling either, so you decided to fire through the side of your head instead, and you were going to do it, then you weren’t, and then you were.
mt: 你把槍管放到嘴裏，碰到了牙齒，你不喜歡這種感覺。於是你決定對準太陽穴開槍，你打算這樣做。之後你又不想這樣做了，接著你又想這樣做。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: She wants you to think you wrote an entry and can’t remember it, for which there seems no motive. Or she found the journal, was reading it, and spilled something on those pages and had to tear them out.
mt: 只有可能是桑德拉撕掉的，要麼她覺得你寫了日記，但是不記得了，不過可能性不大；要麼她找到了日記本，閱讀的時候不小心把什麼東西濺在頁面上，只好撕下來。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate inference.

src: Jerry knows it’s that time of the year when things happen quickly, that back at his house he’d have gone from mowing the lawns once every two months during winter to once a week during summer.
mt: 樹木萌發出嫩芽，一片勃勃生機的景象。傑瑞知道，每逢這個時節，萬物都在瘋狂而野蠻地生長。他家裡的草地在冬天時每兩個月才修剪一次，而到了夏天每隔一個星期就要修剪一次。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with contextual enhancement.

src: She keeps rubbing her thumb against the pad of her ring finger, where she’s sporting the type of callus he’s seen on guitar players.
mt: 她拇指不停地揉擦著無名指，撫弄著老繭，這種老繭他曾在一個吉他手的手上見過。

src: Probably somebody he met in the bar last night, or somebody he signed a book for.
mt: 這人應該是他昨晚在酒吧見過的，要麼就在他書上籤過名。

src: Why couldn’t you have sat down then, F.J.?
mt: 你為什麼不能坐下來呢？

src: She’s coming over for dinner tomorrow night. She’ll ask to pass the salt, and you’ll say sure, and by the way I’m dying.
mt: 她明天晚上會過來吃飯，她會說勞煩把鹽遞過來，你會說好的，對了，我快要死了。

src: It’s chicken and ham with tomato. He picks out the tomato and offers it to Hans who shakes his head. He dumps it back into the bag.
mt: 他把番茄挑出來，遞給漢斯，漢斯搖搖頭，他便把它放回購物袋裡。

src: But he thinks Henry was tearing them out because Henry was just as crazy as Jerry, and when you’re the king of Mount Crazy, you do things that don’t make sense.
mt: 但是，他認為是亨利撕毀的，因為亨利和傑瑞一樣瘋了，做什麼都是沒有意義的。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: So she came and saw Jerry while Sandra was at work, and Jerry told her he had no idea what in the hell she was talking about, and she pointed out that Jerry had the same goddamn color spray-paint on his fingers, which Jerry pointed out wasn’t paint, but ink, because he’d written one hundred and ten goddamn names on one hundred and ten goddamn place cards the previous night for the wedding, and he’d been using a felt, so stop accusing him of spray-painting on her wall when, obviously, she was a cunt and everybody in the street knew it, giving everybody in the street a motive.
mt: 果真，她就趁著桑德拉去工作的時候來找傑瑞了。傑瑞告訴她，他不知道她到底在說些什麼。她說傑瑞手指上留著與噴漆顏色一樣的漆印，傑瑞說這不是漆印，是墨跡，因為他在伊娃婚禮的前一天晚上在一百一十張該死的請柬上寫了一百一十個該死的名字。他是用簽字筆寫的，所以，請不要再編派他在她的牆上噴漆了。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary translation.

src: “And you are?”
mt: 「你是哪位？」

src: He’s always felt like he needed to sign a different message in every book.
mt: 他總是喜歡在不同的書上寫不同的內容。
llm_reason: Accurately captures the essence of the original sentence.

src: Jerry was confused. Jerry fucked up. Jerry is as mad as a hatter.
mt: 傑瑞迷迷糊糊的，傑瑞懵懵懂懂的，傑瑞瘋瘋癲癲的。

src: Sure, you lost your dad in a pool, you left your coffee there, and your keys, but that’s just carelessness—after all, you do have a world full of people living inside your head looking for a voice, remember? All those characters? Serial killers and rapists and bank robbers, and of course then there’s the bad guys too (that’s a joke).
mt: 你在泳池邊永遠失去了父親，又在泳池邊落了咖啡和鑰匙，但那只是粗心大意罷了，畢竟，你的腦中還得去構思那些形形色|色的人物，你還記得嗎，連環殺手、作姦犯科者和銀行劫匪，總之都是些罪惡滔天的壞蛋（這是一個玩笑）。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with preserved tone and meaning.

src: In saying that, there is definitely less of a need to keep writing here—why would anybody clearly not mad need to keep a Madness Journal? You barely read from it anymore anyway.
mt: 說到日記，你真的沒有必要再去寫，為什麼一個不再是狂人的人要去寫「狂人日記」呢？

src: Hans carries the journal over to the couch and sits down, the phone going with him, not leaving a lot of light for Jerry.
mt: 漢斯拿著日記走近沙發，坐下，手機拿在他手上，傑瑞那裡就沒有多少光亮了。

src: His concern about being Henry becomes concern for the other things he’s done, the ultimate concern being Henry is the one who killed Sandra.
mt: 他的擔憂從一開始被亨利掌控變成了他會做些不可告人的事，最終他的擔憂成了亨利才是殺死桑德拉的兇手。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: Think, Jerry, come on, you’re almost there, you’re—”
mt: 你好好想想，傑瑞，加把勁，你就快想起來了，你——」

src: “The devil is in the details,” Jerry says, and back then the devil was him, and these days those details are hard to hang on to.
mt: 「魔鬼就潛伏在細節中。」傑瑞說。說這話時，傑瑞就是魔鬼，這些天所有細節都變幻莫測，很難臨摹和重繪。
llm_reason: Accurate and literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: Sure, sure, happy to help.
mt: 當然，當然，我非常樂意。

src: The lowdown. Future Jerry, you don’t know for a fact you did what they think you did.
mt: 未來的傑瑞，你不知道你做了什麼，但他們認定是你做的。

src: “The longer you try and avoid them, the harder it’s going to go when they find you.”
mt: 你拖的時間越長，事情就越糟糕，他們終究會找到你的。」

src: They run downstairs, each of them stumbling, Jerry tripping into Hans, Hans tripping into Jerry, more good luck than anything else keeping them upright as Hans’s cell phone lights the way. When they get to the bottom they don’t actually know where to turn.
mt: 他們跑到樓下，兩個人都被絆了一下，傑瑞絆了漢斯，漢斯絆了傑瑞，不過因為有漢斯的手機照路，兩個人都沒有摔倒。

src: You choose the house of a woman who somehow you know is alone. That’s what we’re saying here, right?”
mt: 偏偏你所選擇的女人都是獨居，這就是癥結所在了，對吧？」

src: Jesus, next thing they’ll get a giant cat door just for you and you’ll have to . . .
mt: 天啊，接下來他們是不是要給你安裝一個巨大的貓門啊？

src: We go and find a sunset somewhere, we have a few drinks, we reminisce about old times, and we both drink a little too much and you take some pills and you—”
mt: 我們浪跡天涯，尋找夕陽，喝幾杯酒，懷念往昔，醉眼矇矓，然後你拿出一些藥片，你——」
llm_reason: Faithful to original meaning and tone with natural literary flow.

src: He doesn’t know. Something. Not crush their car, but something.
mt: 他不知道，不會撞到他們的車，但肯定會發生什麼的。

src: Jerry doesn’t answer him. “The shit we see every day, and we see a lot of shit, don’t we, Chris?”
mt: 「這種人渣我們每天都能看見，我們見過很多，對吧，克里斯？」

src: We’ll ask you something that you’ll have no idea about. Some things will come back to you, but there are things that refuse to.
mt: 我們會問一些你不知道的事情，有些你會想起來，有些就想不起來。

src: At what?
mt: 什麼？
llm_reason: Direct and accurate translation of interrogative.

src: The truth is, my entire life I have had needs I’ve been able to keep in check, only occasionally letting my true self out to play, hurting women on those occasions.
mt: 其實我的生活很壓抑，只是偶爾讓真實的自我出來放縱一下，傷害了那些女人。

src: “There is no Suzan?”
mt: 「沒有蘇姍這個人？」

src: “I have every right because you’re my husband and I love you, and I hate that this thing is happening to you, but it is, and I need to know what’s going on in here so I can help you,” she said, and she tapped the side of her head, but really she should have been tapping the side of his.
mt: 「我有充分的權利看你的日記，因為你是我丈夫，我愛你，我不想看到這種事發生在你身上，但它還是發生了。我需要知道你這裏究竟在想什麼，這樣我才能幫你。」她說著，拍了拍自己的頭，但其實她應該拍他的頭，這讓她像個瘋婦一般。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: Somehow the dead man feels heavier than he did five minutes ago.
mt: 不知怎的，那死人的分量比五分鐘前更沉重了。

src: Her friends told her to contact the police, to get a restraining order, but she defended him. She said he wasn’t really that bad, even though he had hit her a few months before they broke up, just the once, if you don’t include the other time he’d pushed her hard into the wall.
mt: 她的朋友讓她報警，拿到禁制令，但她為他辯解說他還沒有那麼糟，儘管他們分手前幾個月他動手打了她。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: she asked, and she was angry, vein-throbbing angry, not like the time you forgot your anniversary a few years back but closer to the time you forgot her birthday.
mt: 她問你。她很生氣，青筋直暴，那模樣不像幾年前你忘了結婚紀念日，反倒像你忘記她的生日。

src: Who would do this? Eva’s voice was coming through the phone, saying these things over and over.
mt: 電話里傳來伊娃的聲音，她一遍又一遍地說。

src: You wandered off ONCE and instead of being sympathetic, Sandra is putting in the boot.
mt: 對於你的走丟，桑德拉沒有表示同情，反而落井下石。

src: She hasn’t been dead long, but she is dead— there’s no denying that—CPR isn’t going to help.
mt: 但她死了，這一點不用懷疑，心肺復甦也起不了作用。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation preserving core meaning.

src: Getting out of his chair.
mt: 離開他的椅子。

src: Three times where he’s essentially been sleepwalking. Only it should be called wakewalking.
mt: 實際上他三次都是在夢遊，或者他應該叫自己為「夢遊人」。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with correct nuance.

src: But it wasn’t lost and found, it was the police trying to get you to go back.”
mt: 不是失物招領處，而是警方想讓你回去。」

src: You wanted to tell Doctor Goodstory to either change his profession or change his last name, because the two couldn’t be any further apart.
mt: 你想對古德斯特里醫生說：「要麼改行，要麼改姓。」

src: Jerry nods. He is Understanding Jerry.
mt: 傑瑞點點頭，他現在是「通情達理」的傑瑞。

src: He doesn’t hesitate. He swings it towards the man who killed his wife. He swings it as hard as he can, swings it for Sandra, for the florist, he swings it for Suzan with a z, he swings it for Eva, for everybody this man has hurt, for all of those that have had their lives ruined by their own Captain A.
mt: 他不再猶豫了，拿起刀向殺死他妻子的男人刺過去，為了桑德拉，為了花店老闆，為了蘇姍，為了伊娃，為了受到過這人傷害的每一個人，為了那些被「阿爾茨船長」毀掉的所有人。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with preserved emotional depth.

src: He’s thinking he should have gone for the knife. Should have done something.
mt: 他心想，剛才應該去拿刀的，這樣可以做一些事情。

src: The room is carpeted, which makes it unlikely there are any hiding spaces beneath the floorboards, but he still kicks at it anyway, listening for something that might give, but there’s nothing.
mt: 房間里鋪著地毯，地板下面不像是有任何暗格，但他還是用腳踢著，側耳聆聽下面會不會發出空洞的聲音，但什麼也沒有。

src: You can’t switch it off. We’re going to tell the police you have confused the news story with your own reality the same way you confuse your fiction with your reality.
mt: 我們要告訴警察你把新聞報道和現實世界弄混淆了，而且還把小說情節與現實世界弄混淆了。

src: He can see it, but he can’t reach it. Hans is turning the gun back towards him. It’s happening in slow motion. It’s pointing at the wall, at the chair, at Jerry’s shoulder, then at his chest, and as the gun gets into position the expression on Hans’s face changes too, first one of anger, then frustration, then he smiles.
mt: 先是指向牆，再指向椅子，接著指向傑瑞的肩膀，最後對準他的胸口，隨著槍一步一步對準，漢斯臉上的表情也在變化，先是憤怒，然後是沮喪，繼而是微笑。

mt: 臉的上方整齊地寫著「爸爸最酷的想法」，書脊上寫著「燃燒的船長」。

src: It missed and hit the wall behind her. She had never seen him like that, and it frightened her. It worried her. She knew even before Jerry was diagnosed that no matter what the problem was, she would stay by his side.
mt: 她從未見過這樣的傑瑞，這讓她驚恐不安，但她知道，無論最後傑瑞被診斷出什麼，她都會矢志不渝地留在他身邊。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: Hans seems to think about it, and Jerry is suddenly sure his friend is about to say no, but then he relents and tosses it over.
mt: 漢斯似乎在猶豫，那一瞬間傑瑞覺得他的朋友肯定會說不，但後來他還是答應了，他把日記扔了過來。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: You could have done it, you know. You could have done the world and that poor young girl a favor and put that gun into your mouth back when Doctor Goodstory gave you the news.
mt: 你知道你能辦到的，你可以幫這個世界、這個可憐的女孩一個忙，當古德斯特里醫生把消息告訴你時，你明明就可以把槍放到嘴裏。

src: Or, in this case, the wall they are hidden behind. His heart is already hammering, but when he steps across the threshold into the house it hammers even more, so loud that if there are people asleep upstairs it’ll be his heart that wakes them.
mt: 他的心怦怦直跳，當他跨過門檻進入房屋，它跳得更快了，心跳聲如此之大，要是有人睡在樓上，肯定能將他們驚醒。

src: Nice long legs, blond hair down to her shoulders, athletic curves and tones. She has a set of blue eyes that keep pulling him in. She’s in a tight, black skirt and a snug-fitting dark blue top that he’d like to see on the floor.
mt: 她雙腿筆直而修長，金髮齊肩，身體曲線婀娜，穿著緊身黑色短裙和修身的深藍色上衣，一雙湛藍的眼眸惹得他心神蕩漾。

src: You need the journal to help remember who you are, because this disease you’re pretending you don’t have, well, you have it.
mt: 你需要它，它可以幫助你記住自己是誰，你明明有病，卻假裝自己正常得很。

src: “Get some rest,” the woman says, this bear-sized woman who bear hugged him earlier and abducted him from his home.
mt: 「休息一下。」女人說。這個虎背熊腰的女人剛剛抱住了他，從家裡把他綁架了過來。

src: He uses the phone to go online, and he has to concentrate, really concentrate to remember his own email address so he can log in, letting his fingers roam over the phone, being guided by muscle memory, which he manages to do, the address coming to him, and back in the day—the day of Sane Jerry—he used the same password for everything.
mt: 他必須集中精力，集中精力，好想起自己的電子郵箱地址，這樣就可以登錄。他的手指在手機上划來划去，想通過肌肉的記憶回憶起電子郵箱地址。回想當年，在傑瑞神志正常的那些日子里，他所有的賬戶都設置成一樣的密碼。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: She doesn’t even have time to struggle. It only takes a couple of seconds, and then she’s asleep, Hans lowering her gently to the ground.
mt: 她甚至來不及反抗掙扎，只過了幾秒鐘，她就睡著了。

src: How can you be so sure it wasn’t?
mt: 「你怎麼能這麼肯定？
llm_reason: Core question preserved, natural literary translation.

src: That’s the man telling me what I can’t do. The man frowning on me because I shot Sandra.
mt: 會有人皺著眉頭看著我，告訴我我不能，因為我殺了桑德拉。

src: One of them was tearing them out to protect him, to keep the bad things he was doing a secret.
mt: 撕掉日記的那幾頁是為了保護他，掩蓋他做的壞事。

src: This isn’t being written down because you think things are going to work out okay, or that Captain A has found a different white whale to chase and doesn’t need this vessel anymore, but because when your family looks back at everything, they can understand what it was like.
mt: 這件事之所以沒有寫下來，是因為你以為事情會順利解決的。或者說，「阿爾茨船長」發現了另一頭白鯨去駕馭，這艘船就可以捨棄了。當你的家人回顧這一切時，他們可以感同身受。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: “Nowhere. This is the place.”
mt: 「沒有，就是這兒。」

src: You’ve spent your lifetime putting your thoughts down on paper, Future Jerry, and in this case it’s not the pages going up in flames, but the mind that created them.
mt: 未來的傑瑞，你用了畢生的時間把自己的想法寫在紙頁上，但在阿爾茨海默病的影響下，毀於一旦的不是書本，而是創造它們的思想。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with context preserved.

src: There is no Suzan with a z.”
mt: 根本就沒有一個叫蘇姍的人。」

src: Bad news—one of the puppet eyes glued to the journal got crushed against the wall when you threw it. It looks foggy now, like a cataract.
mt: 壞消息：你砸日記本時，粘在封面外殼上的一隻木偶眼睛撞在牆上摔碎了，眼睛裡頭瀰漫著一片霧氣，像是木偶得了白內障。

src: He looks at the back of the door to make sure it’s the same stall. Fuck the world.
mt: 他看著門的背面，確定了這是相同的隔間——「這操蛋的世界！」
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: It’s awkward getting Eric out of the back of the car. He’s heavier than Mrs. Smith, and Jerry is sure he’ll have a sore back tomorrow from all this lifting.
mt: 把艾瑞克從車後座弄出來挺棘手的，他比史密斯太太重太多了。

src: She wasn’t crying, but she was close. Her mouth was shaking a little. You walked over to her, and you felt strong. She put her arms out and you stepped into them and wrapped your own around her and she sobbed into your neck and held you tight, and she felt like she’s always felt, warm and comfortable, and before Captain A ruined your life you would hug Sandra like that all the time.
mt: 你向她走過去，她張開手臂，你擁抱了她，她把臉貼在你的脖子上啜泣，緊緊地擁抱著你，她給你的感覺一如既往的溫馨舒適，在「阿爾茨船長」摧毀了你的生活之前，你會一直這樣擁抱著桑德拉。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: Your name is Jerry Grey, and you are scared. You’re sitting in your study writing this while your wife, Sandra, is on the phone with her sister, no doubt in tears because this future of yours, well, buddy, nobody saw it coming.
mt: 你的名字是傑瑞·格雷，此刻你正驚魂未定地坐在書房裡寫東西，而你的妻子桑德拉正在和她妹妹凱蒂通電話，淚流滿面地說著你的將來該怎麼辦。

src: Your wife is forty-eight years old and even though you don’t have a future, she still does.
mt: 你的妻子四十八歲了，即使你已窮途末路，但她仍有灑滿餘暉的未來。

src: “You’re making that up,” he says, trying to figure out a reason why Hans would, and coming to the conclusion he wouldn’t. “Even if you’re not, visiting her at work isn’t the same as killing her.”
mt: 他想找出漢斯為什麼會扯淡騙他，結果他得出結論，他不會騙他的，「即使你沒有扯淡，在她工作時去看望她也不等同於殺害她。」

src: Let’s not blame society, the justice system, the mental health system, the economy, let’s not try to shorten the gap between the rich and the poor, let’s not blame education and people slipping through the cracks, and minimum wage not covering the cost of living and forcing people to do things they normally wouldn’t, let’s not blame the twenty-four-hour news cycle instilling fear into everybody, or how easy it is to get a gun, let’s blame the author, it’s his fault, lock all the authors up and there’s your world peace,” he says, and he can feel his heart rate climbing, can feel something pulsing in his forehead, can feel the old Jerry returning.
mt: 不要怪社會、司法、醫療、經濟，別再徒勞地縮小貧富差距，別再責怪教育，不要在乎人民的關注度夠不夠，不要抱怨最低工資不能維繫基本生活，不要強迫人們做他們辦不到的事情，不要指責二十四小時新聞向人們灌輸社會的陰暗面，或者太容易搞到槍支。讓我們責怪作者，犯罪是他的錯，把所有的作家都拘押起來，你的世界就和平了。」他感到心跳加速，額頭上青筋暴起，彷彿原來的傑瑞回到了身體里。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary translation.

src: “Come on, this is us just shooting the breeze,” Mayor says, “ain’t that right, Chris?”
mt: 「好了，我們只是在閑聊。」梅厄說，「是不是啊，克里斯？」

src: As annoying as she is, the last thing he wants is her falling over and cracking her head open. He tries to keep his grip on the hockey stick to stop her from falling, but she’s too heavy, and the stick comes out of his hands.
mt: 他想抓住曲棍球棒不讓她摔倒，但她太重了，球棒從他的手裡脫開。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: From the day you moved onto that street, you used to talk about how hot the girl was that lived opposite you.
mt: 傑瑞說。「你以前提到過她很多次。自從你搬到那條街之日起，你就經常說住在你對面的女孩如何如何性感、如何如何火辣。

src: Jerry closes his eyes. He pictures his office.
mt: 傑瑞閉上眼睛，腦海中浮現出他的寫作房。

src: “Look at me, Jerry. Do I look like I’ve ever been afraid of anyone?”
mt: 「看著我，傑瑞，難道我像是怕過誰的人嗎？」

src: Hans tilts his head back and covers his face with his hands. He keeps them there, so the words are muffled when he talks. “There was another killing last week,” he says, then drags his fingers down to his chin, stretching out the skin on his face and tugging down the bottom of his eyes. “It’s still unsolved.
mt: 漢斯陷入了沉思，他歪著頭，雙手捂著臉，保持著這個姿勢一動不動，所以說話時有些含混不清：「上星期也有人被殺害。」

src: In King Kong Escapes, King Kong was pitted against his exact robot duplicate, a battle of the titans, and boy how he loved those B movie posters from half a century ago and how much Sandra hated them, how she wouldn’t let him hang them anywhere else in the house.
mt: 在影片《金剛的逆襲》中，金剛與他的複製機器人對決。他還記得自己有多麼喜歡這張半個世紀前的B級電影的海報，記得桑德拉有多麼討厭它，他把它掛在哪兒她都不準。

src: “We need to pull up the rest of the floor,” Jerry says, and gets to his feet.
mt: 「我們需要撬開其他的地板。」傑瑞站了起來。

src: She asked if you would be okay waiting in the car, and you said yes, and that bit you remember, but then Captain A tightened the reins a little and Belinda found you sitting on the back doorstep talking to her cat a few minutes later.
mt: 她問，你在車上等她可不可以，你說沒問題，但隨後「阿爾茨船長」收緊纜繩，幾分鐘后貝琳達發現你坐在後門口跟她的貓說話。

src: Jerry can’t tell if he’s scored a point or if Mayor’s just thinking about his next question.
mt: 傑瑞不知道是不是因為自己佔了上風，還是說梅厄在思考他的下一個問題。

src: You thought about how some suicides fail, how the bullet changes path and rattles around the skull and makes a lot of damage but doesn’t kill. You put the gun back into your mouth.
mt: 你想過一些自殺失敗的案例，比如子彈改變彈道，擦過顱骨，雖然受傷但沒法置你于死地。

src: He can still hear the sound Eric’s head made when it hit the pavement, can feel that sound vibrating around the bones in his body, like biting heavily on a ball bearing and cracking a tooth. He wipes his sleeve over his mouth.
mt: 艾瑞克的頭部撞擊地面的碰撞聲，混著他身體里骨頭的折斷聲仍在他耳邊迴響，那聲音就像在滾動軸承上狠狠地咬上一口崩掉牙齒一樣。

src: While it’s booting up, he goes through the closet where there are some clothes hanging and some boxes on the ground. He starts pulling them out.
mt: 等著電腦開機時他翻查衣櫃，裏面掛著一些衣服，底部放著盒子，他把它們拖了出來。

src: It must be the social event of the year the way Sandra and Eva are racing around.
mt: 「這一定會成為今年的社交大事，桑德拉和伊娃都在四處奔走。

src: “And kill the new owners, well, you take one more step and I’ll put this through the side of your head.”
mt: 「殺死新主人，好吧，你要是再往前走一步，我就用這個抽你腦袋。」

src: “I remember thinking on this night people would be born and people would die,” he says, his eyes still closed, “and that the stars didn’t care, that even the stars weren’t forever and life was fleeting.
mt: 「我還記得，當時我想，在這個夜晚有人降生，有人死去，」他說道，雙眼仍然緊閉著，「但星辰是不會在意的。連星辰都不是永生的，何況這白駒過隙的人生。

src: Tell me, Hans, tell me, did I do these things?”
mt: 告訴我，漢斯，告訴我，我是不是殺了人？」

src: You can say what you want and you don’t have to own it because it’s not Jerry, it’s his bloody Alzheimer’s, but you have to own this one because half the world has already seen it.
mt: 你想說什麼就胡亂說什麼，說完了又不承認，因為說那些話的不是傑瑞，是該死的阿爾茨海默病。可是這次你必須承認，世界上一大半的人都看到了。

src: You didn’t sleep well, just in fits and starts, and you lost count of how many times you reached across the bed, needing to find Sandra asleep and okay and not being able to.
mt: 你沒有睡好，半夢半醒，你數不清有多少次把手伸到床的那邊，確定桑德拉正在睡覺，確定她沒事，然而，她並不在那裡。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation preserving core meaning.

src: Hearing it coming over the radio is a confirmation Jerry doesn’t want.
mt: 收音機里的報道是傑瑞不想聽到的新聞。

src: Damn you, Past Jerry, for letting go, for giving up, for allowing yourself to become this way.
mt: 該死的曾經的傑瑞，因為你的放縱、你的放棄，讓自己變成現在這個樣子。

src: They walk along the waterline, seagulls chirping overhead, people playing, and this—this right now, feels like a normal day. This feels like a normal life.
mt: 他們倆沿著浪花走著，海鷗在上空盤旋，發出陣陣啁啾聲，人們在周圍嬉戲玩耍，這……這……現在，這才像寧靜祥和的一天，是他想要的正常生活。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with preserved tone and meaning.

src: “They’re asking you about Belinda Murray,” Hans says, and here comes the concern Jerry expected from him two minutes ago.
mt: 「他們在問你貝琳達·穆雷。」漢斯說著，臉上露出關切的神情，兩分鐘前傑瑞就希望看到這副表情。

src: Would you rather hear about the knife?
mt: 還是想先聽刀的事呢？

src: The daffodils that were in full force in the spring gardens are now limp and wilted. Some rhododendrons are blossoming, others already so heavy with flowers they’re breaking off and landing with a thud on the lawn. Trees are budding in every direction.
mt: 春天時花園裡盛開的水仙花已經凋零枯萎，杜鵑花正怒放，一些開滿花朵的枝丫不堪重負而折斷了，草坪上處處繽紛落英。

src: It’s this bloody Alzheimer’s of yours, buddy, it’s scrambling your brain.
mt: 你這該死的阿爾茨海默病，老兄，它讓你的腦子亂掉了。」

src: “I feel . . .” Jerry says, then thinks of the best way to sum it up. With the truth, he decides. “I feel embarrassed.”
mt: 「我覺得……」傑瑞說，忽然又一時詞窮，決定照直說了，「我覺得難堪。」

src: Jerry knows the words are true, they feel true, and his body floods with relief. The fear inside him settles.
mt: 這些話給傑瑞一種真實的感覺，他心裏一塊石頭落了地，內心的恐懼也稍稍平息了。

src: “Smelling salts,” he says.
mt: 「嗅鹽。」
llm_reason: Direct and accurate translation of technical term.

src: he says, shouting now. “He found it already!
mt: 他幾乎是在叫喊了，「他已經發現了！

src: At the moment he’s sitting among it, sitting on a bench under a silk tree whose branches are still mostly bare, the sun touching his face.
mt: 此刻他就在一塊草地上，坐在一棵合歡樹下的長椅上。樹木的枝條大多仍是光禿禿的，陽光撫摸著他的臉龐，暖融融的。

src: She was looking forward to spending all of Jerry’s money—oh, the things she would buy!
mt: 她盼望著花光傑瑞的錢，她會大肆採購的。

src: The streets are different but look the same— same houses, same cars, same atmosphere, but then he finds a street that gets a little busier, and he follows it, like following narrow streams to bigger ones until you find the sea, and that’s what happens here, a sea of traffic, of people, a main road he can identify.
mt: ：相似的房子，同樣的汽車，熟悉的氛圍。後來他看到另一條有些繁忙的街道，他沿著街道繼續向前走，就像是最初看到小小的溪流，然後溪流匯聚成大江大河，再交錯成浩瀚的大海，車水馬龍一起湧向一條他可以確定的大道。

src: Then suddenly it all comes to him. Things that didn’t make sense do now, and Jerry can feel himself getting angry.
mt: 所有不合常理的事一股腦地全湧上心頭，傑瑞覺得自己的怒火正不斷往外冒。

src: “Nobody is buying the Alzheimer’s bullshit, Mr. Grey, so stop playing that card.
mt: 「沒有人會買狗屁阿爾茨海默病的賬，格雷先生，所以不要再玩弄這種把戲了。

src: “The drawers were empty when we moved in, but I have a screwdriver in the kitchen.
mt: 「我們搬進來時，抽屜是空的，廚房裡倒是有一把。

src: When you went into the office this morning, you went with the hope she wouldn’t be there, that she would be cooking breakfast or reading a book.
mt: 你今天早上去寫作房時，但願她不在那裡，她應該在做早餐或者讀書。

src: I came into my room earlier and found him elbows deep in my drawer. I think he was looking for my journal.
mt: 我之前走進房間時，發現他在我的抽屜里翻找著什麼。

src: “Jerry—” “You can’t have it both ways,” Jerry says. “I don’t think I did any of it, but if I did, then Sandra’s blood is on your hands for not doing the right thing. You have to live with that.
mt: 「傑瑞——」傑瑞說：「你不能什麼好處都佔了，我認為我沒有殺人，但如果是我乾的，那麼你手上也沾著桑德拉的血，因為你沒有採取正確的行動，你必須背負這種罪孽。

src: He thinks about that. Writing books . . . it does feel familiar.
mt: 他苦苦思索著，寫作……這倒不覺得陌生了。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: You are only forty-nine years old, my friend, and you are staring down the barrel of insanity.
mt: 你才四十九歲啊，我的朋友，就只能眼睜睜地看著自己陷入癲狂。

src: Two of them actually. You wandered down in your robe an hour later and they were standing in the kitchen talking to Sandra, who had just made them coffees, and you didn’t like the way they were looking at her, but what was worse was the way Sandra liked the way they were looking at her.
mt: 一個小時以後，你穿著睡袍溜了下來，看到他們正站在廚房裡和桑德拉說話，她剛剛給他們煮了咖啡，你不喜歡他們盯著她的眼神，但糟糕的是，桑德拉喜歡。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: They drive in silence again.
mt: 他們又陷入沉默。

src: Today you snuck out the window to avoid the house alarms, and the thing is, you have no memory of doing it.
mt: 今天你悄悄翻出窗外，沒有觸發房屋裡的警報器，不過你對此毫無記憶。

src: However, I have been stopped on the edge of the grounds a few times, getting ready to wander into the woods.
mt: 然而，有好幾次我站在庭院邊，打算走進樹叢。

src: It’s because he did the one thing he swore he would never do —he based a character on a real person. Suzan with a z.
mt: 這是因為他打破了自己的誓言：他根據一個真實人物塑造了角色：那個把「珊」寫成「姍」的蘇姍。

src: It means being more careful now about leaving the journal out.
mt: 這意味著你得更加小心了，不要把日記本落在了別的地方。

src: If there is no pill, you will still be able to look back through these pages and know who you were before the early onset dementia, before the Big A came along and took away the good things.
mt: 如果沒有藥片，你仍然能夠通過這本日記找回記憶，在發展成早發性阿爾茨海默病、美好的記憶被剪去之前，起碼你還知道自己是誰。

src: “Come on, let’s just sit down for a moment,” the man says, and he reminds Jerry of a car salesman, the Come on, just take her for a spin, see how she feels, get her out onto the open road and open her up kind.
mt: 「好了，咱們坐一會兒。」那人這麼說著，讓傑瑞想起了汽車推銷員：「來嘛，只是帶她兜兜風，讓她感受一下，把車開到空曠開闊的公路上是什麼滋味。」

src: “You won’t get away with it. The police will know you did it.”
mt: 「你不會得逞的，你不會有好結果的，警察會知道一切都是你乾的。」
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: Nurse Hamilton gives him one of the saddest smiles he’s ever seen, the kind of smile that makes his chest tighten. This woman pities him.
mt: 漢密爾頓護士沖他憂傷地一笑，這是他所見過的最為憂傷的笑容，讓他感覺胸口一陣一陣發緊。

src: “I’ve seen it done,” Hans says.
mt: 「我見過。」漢斯說。

src: And of course you wondered about Hans. About Nurse Mae.
mt: 你對漢斯心存疑慮，對梅護士也心懷疑慮。

src: Then she was running out of the office and out of the house, leaving you alone.
mt: 她跑出寫作房，跑出家門，只剩下你獨自一人。

src: The baker was a guy in his midforties, a good-looking guy with great hair and a great laugh who made Sandra laugh a lot, laugh a lot and touch her own hair (which she wore down, something she hasn’t done in a long time—and you know what that means, right?), and the way they looked at each other made you think this could be the guy she’s going to take table shopping.
mt: 麵包師約莫四十五歲，相貌俊朗，一頭濃密的秀髮。他笑口常開，也惹得桑德拉大笑不已，她笑的時候會擺弄自己的頭髮（頭髮披散著，她已經很長一段時間沒有披過了，你知道這意味著什麼，對吧？），他們倆惺惺相惜，差點兒讓你覺得她要與這傢伙私奔。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone and nuance.

src: “With your history, mate, you do know you’re playing with fire.
mt: 「夥計，以你的閱歷而言，你知道你在玩火吧？

src: He glances at the doll on the fence, and Jerry wonders if he’s conjuring up the same kind of images that Horror Book Henry would have thought back in the days when fiction and nonfiction were two completely different things.
mt: 他看了一眼柵欄上的娃娃，傑瑞心裏納悶，當文學與紀實還是兩個完全不同的概念時，他就能召喚出當年寫恐怖小說的亨利在腦海中浮現的世界？
llm_reason: Accurate and literary translation preserving core meaning.

src: you asked.
mt: 你問。

src: Worry if you learn more, but until then, just try to act normal, he said, and you could picture him using his fingers to make quotation marks around the normal part, the same way people will be doing at your trial during their Jerry used to be normal cross-examinations.
mt: 他說，「等你了解了詳情，那才值得擔憂。但在那之前，就試著一切如常吧。」他說，你可以看見他在說到「如常」這個詞時用手指畫了個感嘆號，在人們對你進行「傑瑞是否還和以前一樣如常」的審訊時，他們也會做這個動作。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone and detail.

src: He is Jerry Cutter.
mt: 他是傑瑞·卡特。

src: So now for the second point of two-for Tuesday.
mt: 現在我們來說說星期二的第二件事。

src: “Even if it is there you might not like what you find.
mt: 「就算找到了，你也可能不會喜歡日記里的內容。

src: Your wife disappeared in the morning to be with Eva and the bridesmaids to go ooh and ahh as they had their hair done, to relax the nerves with a glass of champagne, to have their makeup expertly applied, and to just generally enjoy the morning.
mt: 你妻子上午離開家去陪伊娃和伴娘，在她們做頭髮時表示讚歎，喝杯香檳放鬆放鬆，看著她們駕輕就熟地化妝，享受這個上午。

src: Just as good is a phone. Try to take your phone with you.
mt: 手機也是好東西，要帶著手機。

src: You were drunk, the perfect amount of buzz where it wasn’t going to worry you how far you had to walk, or how much a drink was going to cost, or what kind of bar you ended up in.
mt: 你喝醉了，所以不必擔心你走得有多遠，不必擔心一杯酒多少錢，或者身處什麼酒吧。

src: Eva played it, and it was beautiful, but it made the discussion that was coming up so much harder.
mt: 伊娃彈奏了那首歌曲，旋律優美動人，給接下來的討論算是出了難題。

src: “Jerry, please, I would feel better if it was out of the house.”
mt: 「求你了，傑瑞。如果把它處理掉，我會更安心一些。」

src: Oh, so it’s my books now, is it?
mt: 「哦，是我的書，對嗎？」

src: Soon the wedding party was moving down the aisle, people throwing confetti into the air, an usher waiting at the door, and that’s when it happened, the front doors busting open as the zombies piled in, the doors hitting the walls so hard that wood splintered everywhere.
mt: 少頃，這對新人走過甬道，人們紛紛將彩紙屑拋向空中。迎賓員還等候在門口，忽然間前門砰地被打開，重重地撞向牆壁，木屑四濺，一隊從墓地里爬出來的殭屍湧入了教堂。
llm_reason: Accurate and vivid literary translation with preserved scene and tone.

src: You’re going to stand there like an idiot, trying foods, being asked what you think is best, then having whatever opinion you do have overruled by one of the girls.
mt: 才沒趣呢，你會站在那兒，像個白痴一樣試吃食物，他們會問你哪個最好吃，無論你提出什麼意見都會被一個女孩否決。

src: Harboring a fugitive will see you back in jail.”
mt: 窩藏逃犯會判你入獄。」
llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation of legal consequence.

src: You could live on desserts, and why not? Soon you’re not going to care how you look.
mt: 你甚至可以把甜點當主食了，不久之後你也不會在意自己的身材。

src: “Whether you did this or not,” Hans says, “you look guilty. Nobody is going to see it any differently.
mt: 漢斯說：「無論你殺沒殺人，你都有重大的嫌疑，但沒有人會覺得那有什麼區別。

src: What’s doubtful are the cops getting here in the time it takes for you to travel from the window to the patio.
mt: 在你從窗戶掉到院子里的這一會兒工夫里，警察會及時趕到嗎？這一點也值得懷疑。

src: This entry isn’t going to start with good news or bad news, but with weird news. Two pages have been torn out from this journal, the two pages after the last entry. You didn’t do it, and you didn’t write in them either because you me us we are still sane. Two blank pages gone.
mt: 今天的日記不會以好消息或壞消息開始，而是以奇怪的消息開始：日記本中有兩頁被撕掉了，就在上一篇的后兩頁，這並不是你乾的，何況你在那兩頁上什麼也沒有寫，你還清醒得很。

src: Once you were at his flat studying and he was practicing how to pick a lock, not because he needed to break into a house, but to see if he could, then he spent hours trying to teach you what he had learned, not for your benefit, but just to see if teaching was another one of his abilities.
mt: 他練習撬鎖不是因為要私闖民宅，而是看他有沒有這個本事；隨後他又花了幾個小時把自己學到的教給你，教給你不是為了讓你受益，而只是為了看看他有沒有教學這個本事。

src: “It’s a pen name,” his daughter says, his beautiful daughter, his lovely daughter with a monster of a father, a disgusting old man who moments ago wondered how she would feel beneath him.
mt: 「這是筆名。」他女兒說。他的女兒貌美如花、秀麗可愛，卻有一個怪物般的父親，就在剛才，這個令人厭惡的老男人竟然還在琢磨著要是把她壓在身下，她不知感覺如何。

src: But The Man Goes Burning is a mess.
mt: 但《燃燒的男人》就是一堆文字垃圾。

src: “I’m not . . .
mt: 「我不……我不清楚。」

src: “I am the neighbor that . . . that murderer was harassing before he shot his wife.
mt: 「我是被那個……那個開槍打死老婆的兇手騷擾過的鄰居。

src: “There was a shirt under the floor,” Jerry says, wishing his friend could keep up.
mt: 「地板下面有一件襯衫。」傑瑞說，希望他的朋友能聽明白。

src: I don’t want this to sound mean, but perhaps it’s best you leave it alone.
mt: 我不希望讓它聽起來不懷好意，但你最好不要管。

src: He remembers that—it was a question journalists always used to throw his way.
mt: 他還記得記者也老是問這樣的難題。

src: Because Eric’s hands were tied behind him, he never had the chance to try to use his arms to break his fall.
mt: 由於艾瑞克的手被綁在身後，他沒有機會用手臂減弱撞向地面的衝擊力。

src: Part of the room was lit up by an alarm clock, part was lit up because the curtains were thin and there was a streetlamp outside.
mt: 鬧鐘發出的微光和外面的路燈透過薄薄的窗帘照亮了房間的一角。

src: Jerry always thought his friend would be capable of something like this, but seeing it happen makes his own stomach clench.
mt: 傑瑞一直知道他的朋友擅長此類事情，但親眼見到還是感到自己的胃一陣陣地緊縮。

src: There is something there— something coming to the surface. He looks at the way her thumb rubs against the callus on her finger, and there’s something familiar about that. Somebody he knows used to do that.
mt: 有些東西——他好像回想起了有些東西，他看著她的拇指磨蹭著無名指上的老繭，感覺有些似曾相識，他認識的一個人以前肯定經常做這個動作。

src: “But we need to slide the desk back and we need something to pry it up. I used to use a screwdriver. There should be one in the desk.”
mt: 傑瑞說，他轉過身子，指著桌子下面，「但我們得把它推到一邊，找個東西把它撬起來，我以前用的螺絲刀，辦公桌里應該有一把。」

src: When he tries to stand he finds that he can’t. His legs aren’t with him, and, and . . . who is this woman?
mt: 他掙扎著想站起來，雙腿卻不像是自己的……這個女人是誰？

src: You told her no, that you want to stay here as long as you can. You told her you don’t want to go into a home, that there’s enough money and enough insurance to hire home care.
mt: 你告訴她不行，你想住在這裏，不想搬家，還有足夠的錢和保險金請家庭護理。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: Hopefully this is as bad as it’s going to get.
mt: 希望這已經是最糟糕的情況了。

src: The written one is full of I’m sorry and I love you.
mt: 寫好的那一份滿篇都是「對不起」還有「我愛你」。

src: From one of the books?
mt: 「書里的？」
llm_reason: Natural literary translation of interrogative phrase.

src: She asked if you had your cell phone, and it turned out you did. She called Sandra at work.
mt: 她問你有沒有帶手機，你帶著，她便打電話給桑德拉。

src: Sadly, the man I used to be is a monster.
mt: 可悲的是，我以前是一個怪物。

src: No wonder he hasn’t had a girlfriend stick around longer than two months.
mt: 難怪都過了兩個多月他一直沒有女朋友。

src: By the end of the year the ratio might be one good day to ten off days.
mt: 等到了年底，這個比例可能是一個美好的日子比十個糟糕的日子。

src: And not this somebody, because this somebody was being rude and not lightening up to the baker who your wife is banging, so this somebody had an alibi, and fifteen minutes later when a pair of officers (not the same pair as Cunt Thursday) intercepted you as you pulled into the driveway to ask what you had seen, Sandra told them neither of you had been home.
mt: 肯定不是某人，因為某人粗魯不堪，不給你妻子心儀的麵包師好臉色，所以某人肯定有託詞為自己開脫的。十五分鐘后，兩個警察（不是星期四的那一對）在你把車駛進車道時攔住了你，問你都看到了什麼，桑德拉告訴他們說，你們兩人都不在家。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with context preserved.

src: He checks over his shoulder as if looking for somebody watching them.
mt: 他扭頭回身，彷彿是在找暗中監視著他們的人。

src: He moves to the chair by the window and looks out at the gardens and watches the sun turn shade into light one degree at a time.
mt: 他走近窗旁的椅子，眺望花園，看著陽光將陰霾驅走。

src: The doctor is a good ten years older than him with teeth so perfect Jerry suspects he may actually be a dentist, then realizes it’d make more sense that the doctor trades medical services with a dentist, swapping the painkillers and the occasional backyard surgery for fillings and root canals.
mt: 醫生比他年長十歲，牙齒潔白整齊，不由得讓傑瑞懷疑他是個牙醫，隨後他覺得，這個醫生應該是常常和牙醫有些來往，換一些止痛藥啦，補補牙啦，做牙根管手術啦，這更現實一點兒。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate inference.

src: “Do you get off on it? You’re just sitting by the TV, waiting for the news to come on every day, sitting with your notepad waiting to be inspired by somebody else’s tragedy?”
mt: 你帶著筆記本，每天守在電視機前等著新聞，等著別人的悲劇激發你的靈感？」
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: “Was the woman this morning killed the way the Bag Man kills?”
mt: 「今天早上被人殺死的那個女孩是按『黑袋狂魔』的手法做的嗎？」

src: Now, he screams, the word inside Jerry’s head almost as loud as the gunshot, so loud, in fact, that Jerry knows he too is shouting out the word.
mt: 就在這時，亨利開口說話了：「行動！」他尖叫著，那個詞撞擊著傑瑞的大腦，幾乎和槍聲一樣嘹亮。其實傑瑞知道，自己也喊出了這個詞。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with preserved tone and meaning.

src: “You’re right, it’s not the same,” Hans says, and he looks away.
mt: 「你說得對，這不一樣。」漢斯說。

src: If that doesn’t work, then perhaps the next step is to have a GPS chip sewn into your back where you can’t reach it.
mt: 如果還是不行的話，也許下一步就要在你的背部縫入一個GPS晶元，你夠不到它的。

src: Other people get sick, and other people die at much younger ages, but this is you me us we.
mt: 有人病魔纏身，有人英年早逝，但這就是我們的宿命。

src: Okay, so it’s not really day one million, and I’m not sure how liberal I was with exaggerations in the books.
mt: 好吧，其實不是真的第一百萬天，我不知道我以前寫書時是多麼隨心所欲地使用誇張的修辭手法。

src: You only had the one drink, and were back to water when the speeches began, and you hated that you didn’t get to say anything, that Sandra was muzzling you for the occasion, and you thought . . .
mt: 你只喝了一杯酒，就又開始喝水了。這時致辭開始了，你恨自己，因為你想不起來說什麼；你也恨桑德拉，因為遇到這種情況她通常會叫你閉嘴。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: Do you have it or did you leave it there?”
mt: 你是拿著還是把它落在那裡了？」

src: It’s been a couple of days since Jerry’s doctor came to see him, days which he hasn’t gone wandering, days which, as far as he’s aware, he has been mostly in control.
mt: 自從傑瑞的醫生過來探望過他之後，他再也沒有偷偷出去遊盪。據他所知，這幾天風平浪靜，他自控得很好。

src: What you do know is that Captain A took over sometime after you wrote in your journal, and when he let go of the controls it was six in the morning and you were sitting on the couch. Your joints were stiff and your feet were sore, and you felt like you’d walked a few miles. You were naked from the waist up.
mt: 你只知道，「阿爾茨船長」有時在你寫完日記之後會接手，等他再放你自由，已經是早上六點鐘了，你呆坐在沙發上，關節僵硬，雙腳酸痛，上身赤|裸，好像你走了好幾公里似的。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: Things had gotten too difficult. Sandra wasn’t dead—the weight of Jerry’s sickness had been too much for her, and she had left rather than let it crush her.
mt: 想要弄清真相真是艱難困阻，桑德拉沒有死，肯定是傑瑞的疾病負擔太重，讓她吃不消，她不想被拖累，所以才離開了。

src: Sometimes you’d take a break from studying and sit out on the back porch and he’d be smoking a joint and you’d be drinking a beer, and you’d have a Rubik’s Cube he was always fiddling with, using the layer method to solve it in a few minutes, trying to learn a way to solve it in under a minute, which he eventually did, before cutting it down to thirty seconds.
mt: 學累了，你們就放下功課，坐在後面的門廊里休息一下，他吸大麻，你喝啤酒。他總喜歡擺弄你的魔方，用分層法在幾分鐘內恢複原狀，接著潛心鑽研另一種方法好在一分鐘內搞定。最終，他做到了，而且只花了三十秒。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with preserved meaning.

src: He sits down on the doorstep with Mrs. Smith watching him, looking as though she wants to wind up her arms and let loose with that hockey stick.
mt: 他在門口坐下，史密斯太太看著他，她看起來好像要揮舞雙臂，把那個曲棍球棒砸過來。

src: “They’re not going to take . . .” Hans says, then stops talking.
mt: 「他們不會……」漢斯說，然後頓住不說了。

src: He climbs out of the car. The day is darkening.
mt: 他邁出汽車，外面夜色如水。

src: Like I say, things vary, but there are consistent themes to your overall state. One of those themes is that often, when you wake up, you wake up believing you’re back in your old life. The sense that everything is as it used to be stays with you sometimes only for a few minutes, sometimes for a few hours. It’s as though you regress to a certain time in your life.
mt: 表現形式雖各不相同，但總體上有一點共通之處：那就是當你醒來時，你總是覺得自己回到了以前的生活，回到了過去的某個片段當中，就像這些已經逝去的一直縈繞在你心頭，有時就短短几分鐘，有時可以維持幾個小時。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation preserving core meaning.

src: It was dark outside. Rain hammered the shit out of the roof, it hammered the shit out of the windows.
mt: 外面一片昏暗，淅淅瀝瀝的雨點敲打著屋頂和門窗。

src: she asked, and she sounded so resigned to the fact there would be more bad news.
mt: 她問，聲音聽起來像是她已經接受了，並做了接受更壞的消息的準備。

src: “Somebody who has access to the nursing home and to the drugs to sedate the patients. Somebody who knows the writer is confessing to crimes. Somebody who hides jewelry in the writer’s pockets so the writer will think he took them.”
mt: 「他能進入療養院給病人下藥，知道作家一直坦承著虛構的罪行，能把首飾揣到作家的口袋裡，讓作家以為是他拿的。」

src: “I heard it. It’s the dementia. Guy can’t even remember his own stories.”
mt: 「我聽見了，這就是老年痴呆症，一個人甚至不記得他自己。」

src: He said he dismissed what you were saying, that he thought you’d probably seen it on the news and you got mixed up the way you’ve been doing lately.
mt: 他說他反駁了你，他認為你可能在新聞里看到這個消息，把它和你最近做的事搞混了。

src: “Well I can keep looking around while you read the journal.
mt: 「我再到處看看，你可以繼續讀讀日記。

src: The can is a holdover from days of Renovation Past, just as there are other paints stored in the garage.
mt: 那些油漆是「改造過去」時用剩下的，就跟存放在車庫裡的其他油漆一樣。

src: Worry if you learn more, but until then, just try to act normal.
mt: 等你了解了詳情，那才值得擔憂。但在那之前，就試著一切如常吧。

src: “You didn’t do this,” Hans says.
mt: 「不是你乾的。」漢斯說。

src: His mind takes him there, but it also takes him to the moments before, those choices made on the way home when the victim could have turned left instead of right, made that green light before it turned red, if they hadn’t skipped their coffee—decisions and processes bringing them closer to death.
mt: 他的想象力不僅牽引著他想到他們被害的場景，還牽引著他來到被害之前的時刻：要是他們遇到十字路口往左轉而不是往右轉，要是綠燈變成了紅燈，要是他們還想再喝一杯咖啡——他們都不會死去的。然而，正是他們的決定，引導著他們一步一步走向死亡。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with preserved meaning.

src: He wants to get the hell out of here—next city please—and tonight, cross his heart and hope to die, he promises he’ll leave the gin and tonics alone.
mt: 他想離開這個鬼地方，最好就在今晚出發前往下一個城市。他不停地在胸口畫著十字，想著不如就地死掉算了。他暗暗發誓，一定要戒掉加了奎寧水的杜松子酒。

src: Good news—there is none.

src: He looks back at the journal. Chunks of it have been stolen and inserted directly into Eric’s manuscript and portrayed as the journal entries of his protagonist.
mt: 日記中成段成段的內容被剽竊，被直接用於艾瑞克的手稿當中，充當他的主角的日記篇目。

src: King Kong Escapes poster on the wall. Only he wouldn’t see it fade, it faded the same way you don’t notice a child growing every day, but you know it’s happening.
mt: 還記得掛在牆壁上鑲框的《金剛的逆襲》海報，他不會看到它在褪色，因為這就好像你注意不到自己的孩子每天都在長高一樣，但你知道它的確正在發生。

src: It seems unlikely the Armed Offenders Squad will be showing up, but it does seem likely he’s breaking some violation by being here—he was committed to a nursing home, he shouldn’t be out and about.
mt: 即便武裝罪犯不大可能到這兒來，可他來到這兒也違反了規定，他應該待在療養院，不應該是外出走動。

src: “Just stay on the line, Jerry.”

src: Come on, let’s start looking around.”

src: Hans closes the door behind him and the lock latches back into place.

src: “In that case they’ll be here any minute, and if it’s the Armed Offenders Unit, they’ll be storming the place.
mt: 「這個時候他們隨時都會趕到這裏，如果是武裝罪犯調查組的，他們將對這個地方強制進攻。

src: “How about we reverse that? How about we do what you write and go and pay this guy a visit.”
mt: 漢斯說，「不如我們就這樣去做，按照你寫的去拜訪那個人怎麼樣？」

src: You don’t. Know.

src: “They get the worst.”
mt: 「結果都是最糟的。」

src: “Very good ones too,” Hans says, interrupting him. “People were always saying how real they felt.
mt: 「書寫得很精彩，」漢斯打斷他，「人們總是說那些故事如何如何真實。

src: He wonders where that table is and wonders if his father sold it so he could buy a few more beers.
mt: 他在想那桌子後來到哪裡去了，心裏納悶父親是不是把它賣了，好多買幾瓶啤酒。

src: These are all—”
mt: 這些都——」

src: “I know. I mean I remember her in the books.”
mt: 「我知道，我是說我記得在書中寫過她。」

src: The nursing home?”
mt: 回療養院？」

src: “But it’s somebody, right? Because I’m not that guy. I can’t be that guy you see on the front page of the paper, the sick, twisted pervert who hurts women.
mt: 因為我不是那種人，我不是你在報紙頭版看到的變態，專門傷害女人。

src: Not one of the worst I’ve ever seen, but pretty damn close.”
mt: 雖然這並不是我見過最糟糕的，但也他媽的差不多了。」

src: There is no furniture in the house, nothing to try and avoid, no rug to trip on.
mt: 房子里沒有傢具，所以沒有什麼好避讓的，不用擔心會有地毯把人絆倒。

src: He holds it loosely from the base of the handle, the way someone would handle it if they were surrendering to an Armed Offenders Unit.
mt: 他輕輕地握住槍把，就像某人向武裝罪犯調查人員繳械投降那樣。

src: “You’ve got a few other marks there,” he says.

src: It wasn’t like that, of course, and that’s not even the most exciting part about the day.

src: But all they heard was Captain A making shit up.

src: He takes his shoes and socks off and carries them.

llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation of action.

src: “Sometimes you would wander,” he says.
mt: 「有時候你會出去遊盪。」

src: The ducks clear the road, heading away from the direction of a park and towards a fish-and-chip shop, making Jerry picture a scenario where the ducks are ordering dinner, and a different scenario where they’re becoming dinner.
mt: 浩浩蕩蕩的鴨子從公園朝著炸魚薯條店的方向走了過去，傑瑞腦海閃現出了這樣一幅畫面：鴨子們在排隊訂餐，另一幅畫面則是它們變成了晚餐。

src: “At random,” Jerry says, because it’s the only senseless answer that makes any kind of sense.
mt: 「隨機的吧。」傑瑞說。現在這是唯一一個毫無道理的答案，卻能解釋當下的問題。

src: Sandra was worried sick by the time you got back to the house.
mt: 你到家了，桑德拉都快擔心死了。

src: You were Captain A, but Captain A has another name, doesn’t he.
mt: 你是「阿爾茨船長」，「阿爾茨船長」還有另一個名字，對吧？

src: For a few moments the office is Jerry’s again.
mt: 在這幾分鐘里，寫作房彷彿又是傑瑞的了。

src: (She had the photograph printed the following day, and on the back she wrote Proudest dad in the world.
mt: （第二天她把照片列印出來，在背面寫道：世上最驕傲的爸爸。如今照片正貼在冰箱上。）
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: “Just some notes,” Jerry says, and he goes back to the loose pages, of which there are another dozen or so.
mt: 「一些筆記。」傑瑞說，他開始看那些零散的紙頁，還有十幾頁。

src: If not for killing, then for what?
mt: 他又不曾殺過人，那麼是為什麼呢？

src: What if the next entry is Past Jerry detailing how he escapes, how much he enjoys a good, old-fashioned bloodletting? What if?
mt: 如果下一篇寫的是「過去的傑瑞」詳細敘說他如何逃離療養院，又是多麼享受老套的殺人方法又怎麼辦？

src: You never have. And right in that moment you remembered that it’s Zach Perkins who smokes, the detective from some of your books, and then you remembered that even he gave up smoking a few books ago.
mt: 就在那一刻，你記起了扎克·帕金斯，他抽煙，他是你在書中塑造的偵探形象，你還記得就在之前的幾本書里，他戒了煙。

src: It’s crazy that he feels uncomfortable with his own daughter, but he does, this giant wall between them feels unbreakable, this wall he put up by being a bad father and an even worse husband.
mt: 如果和自己的親生女兒待在一起還感到不安，那肯定就是有病，但他就是感到不安。一堵巨大的牆壁聳立在兩人之間，牢不可摧。這牆壁之所以存在，都是因為他是個不稱職的父親和不合格的丈夫。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with emotional nuance preserved.

src: Henry has been helping him today, and aren’t there times he suspects that Henry is just another name for Captain A?
mt: 亨利直到今天都在幫助他，他有時會懷疑，亨利只是「阿爾茨船長」的另一個名字。

src: However, if you did step outside, an alarm would go off. And why?
mt: 不過萬一你真的要走出去，會觸發警報器的。

src: They reach the deck and the sun lounger where they had left Mrs. Smith.

src: Jerry keeps staring at the shirt, trying to place it.

src: The counselor came around this afternoon. Her name is Beverly, and her breasts were so huge they were resting on her knees when she sat down, and were almost resting on her knees even when she was standing.
mt: 今天下午，心理諮詢師過來了，她叫貝弗莉，乳|房大得不管站著還是坐著都能垂到膝蓋上。

src: “The way I see it, I’ve always figured a guy who writes the kind of books you write, well, there must be something wrong with him, something sick and twisted inside.
mt: 「依我看，寫這些東西的人肯定有病，腦子不清楚。

src: He decides to stay committed to the cause. To stay on the attack.

src: Jerry takes another bite from the sandwich. “Fine, I’ll think about that, but we also need to figure out who would want to frame me,” he says, talking with a mouth half full.

src: It’s all coming together now.

src: The woman talking isn’t done.

src: Hans makes the decision and Jerry follows.

src: Her face tightened into a scowl when you told her you were drinking.

src: “Last one,” Mayor says.

src: “You said fake it. You said, did I really think Gene Roddenberry had been to Mars?
mt: 「你說虛構就好，你真以為基恩·羅登貝瑞曾到過火星嗎？

src: He taps the side of his head as he asks the question, almost expecting it to make a wooden sound, like the table his parents used to have that was thick wood around the edges but hollow in the middle.
mt: 他邊問邊拍了一下頭，期待這一下能發出像敲擊木頭一樣的聲音。他父母曾用過一張桌子，邊緣是厚厚的木頭，中間卻是空的。

src: nothing hidden in the wall?
mt: ……牆上藏不了東西？

src: She was very upset when you told her, and you were upset too, and why not? It’s something worth being upset about.
mt: 聽了你的話，她有些煩憂，你也很煩憂，這事兒本來就挺讓人煩憂的。

src: Jerry buries his face in his arms as he thinks about Sandra, and if it’s true, if he did hurt her, then what does anything else matter?

src: “Sandra wouldn’t let you drink, and she took your credit card off you so you couldn’t go and buy them.
mt: 「桑德拉不讓你喝酒，她拿走了你的信用卡，所以你也不能買。

src: Could be the smell of fast food and coffee that has soaked into the pores of the upholstery, taking him back to times overseas where he’s eaten in takeaway joints while pressed for time.

src: Be that as it may, Jerry, she is sure it was you and, well, there’s no real delicate way of putting this, but after our conversation the other day, it seems like you’re paying me back.
mt: 「傑瑞，儘管如此，她很肯定是你乾的，雖然沒有辦法證實，但我覺得這是我們那天談話之後，你對我的報復。」

src: On a good day, Henry is nothing more than a pen name, but on a bad day I sometimes wonder if he’s the one who takes over.

src: Eric can’t calm down, but he manages to stop coughing and he manages to stare at his two captors without struggling. He doesn’t manage to hide the fear in his face.

src: “And if there’s time, I was wondering, could I bounce some ideas off you?
mt: 「如果有時間，我想，您能給我指點指點嗎？
「這是……

src: The computer’s word processor has been your medium ever since the day you wrote the words Chapter One of your first book, but using the computer for this . . .

src: They are the words of Henry Cutter.
mt: 是亨利·卡特的話。

src: Things weren’t going to be okay, and let’s not forget, Future Jerry, that by this point in the game she was already screwing the baker and the alarm guys and who knows who else.
mt: 不會好起來的，我們千萬不要忘了，未來的傑瑞，在這場遊戲中，她一直和麵包師胡搞，和安裝警報器的人胡搞，誰知道還有誰呢？

src: Somebody spray-painted the word asshole on your door?

src: He would feel it somehow.

src: The knife.
Come on, we have to go in and prove he did these things.”
mt: 來，我們必須進去，證明他殺了人。」

src: It’s sensory overload. Too much information all in one hit, and he and Henry and even Captain A are all switched off into darkness, but then one simple piece of information sneaks in and reboots his system: he is Jerry Grey and he is a monster. “Jerry?”
mt: 這是感官超負荷的反應，太多的信息擁擠碰撞在一起，他、亨利還有「阿爾茨船長」都陷入深深的黑暗，隨後，一條簡單至極的結論悄然而至，重新啟動了他的意識：他是傑瑞·格雷，他是一個怪物。

src: “At the house?”
