src: You went to the office door to call to Sandra, and as soon as your back was to me I injected you in the neck.
mt: 你到寫作房門口，去叫桑德拉，你背對著我時，我就在你脖子上打了一針。

src: It’s looking like Henry isn’t a dessert guy, but a rape and murder guy.
mt: 亨利並不喜歡甜點，他是個強|奸犯，是個殺人兇手。

src: Soon an intersection has to make sense. He reaches a park two blocks later. There’s a bunch of playground equipment in the middle but, thankfully, no kids, which means he can sit on the bench and not have anybody rush over to call him a child molester while he’s collecting his thoughts.
mt: 穿過兩條街后，他來到了公園，公園中間有兒童遊樂場，不過還好，遊樂場里沒有小孩子，這意味著他可以坐在長椅上整理思緒，不必擔心有人跑過來說他是來猥褻兒童的。

src: Day thirty. There’s a couch in the office. The Thinking Couch. You’ll lie there sometimes and come up with ideas for the books, work on solutions, lie there and listen to Springsteen cranked so loud the pens will roll off the desk.
mt: 第三十天，寫作房裡有張「思考沙發」，以前，你總會躺在那裡一邊構思書稿，一邊聽著斯普林斯汀那蕩氣迴腸的音樂。

src: You can do it, Henry says, and Jerry decides it’s neither here nor there.
mt: 「你可以做到。」亨利說，但傑瑞認為這無關緊要了。

src: You’re actually a pretty good cook. It’s one of your things—and you don’t have many things. You can write, you can play pool, you know some card tricks, you can catch Alzheimer’s like catching a cold, and you can cook.
mt: 你其實是一個手藝不錯的廚師，也算是你為數不多的拿得出手的東西：你會寫作，會打檯球，知道一些打牌的竅門，會像得感冒一樣患上阿爾茨海默病，當然了，還有做飯。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: They give you Alzheimer’s too?”
mt: 是他們讓你患上阿爾茨海默病的嗎？」

src: “I want you to get rid of the gun,” she said, staying calm.
mt: 「我想讓你把槍處理掉。」她平靜地說。

src: His mouth is dry. His heart is hammering again, and soon it won’t be able to hammer anymore.
mt: 他的嘴巴乾澀，心臟再次狂跳，但很快就平息了。

src: “This is the house where Sandra died, Jerry, and you may be about to read your own account of being her killer.
mt: 「桑德拉就死在這座房子里，傑瑞，你可能會讀到親手殺死她的陳述。

src: You found the loose floorboard when you moved into the house, and at the time thought it’d be a good place to hide a gun, so gave that to the character you were writing about at the time.
mt: 是的，絕對是的。當你搬進來時發現了那塊鬆動的地板，你覺得這是塊藏槍的好地方，所以就把這一想法賦予書中的角色了。

src: I think it might have been a mistake bringing you here. If I had known it still looked like this,” she says, but doesn’t finish the thought.
mt: 我想帶你到這兒來可能是個錯誤，要是我早知道會這樣的話……」她說，但沒說完。

src: “You can do better,” Hans says.
mt: 「你可以寫得更好。」漢斯說。

src: People have to be messed up first. By the time our books come along there’s already something seriously wrong with them.”
mt: 人們首先會心懷惡意，等到我的書出版時，他們心中鬼胎已經深種了。」

src: Terrance asks. “You pour your life and soul into a novel, and somebody can dissect it in all sorts of cruel ways in such a short time.”
mt: 特倫斯問，「您把生命和靈魂都傾注到小說之中，人們可以在片刻之間以痛苦的方式解讀出來。」

src: They’ll probably go back further too. They’re going to say I got sick five years ago. Or ten.
mt: 可能會更離譜，他們會說我是五年前得的病，或十年前得的病。

src: You asked why she was living in your house. She asked who you were, and you were . . . a little unsure, but you had your wallet, it had your driver’s license (Sandra in all her Let’s control Jerry wisdom at least didn’t take that off you), and once your name was out in the open you became Functioning Jerry, at least a little, and you told her where you lived.
mt: 你問她為什麼住在你的房子里，結果她問你是誰，你是……你有點兒不確定，但你帶著錢包，裏面有你的駕照（桑德拉只是想控制你，但她至少沒有把駕照拿走），你的名字終於水落石出了，現在你就成了正常的傑瑞，至少你能告訴她你住在哪兒。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: What about the bag, Jerry?
mt: 塑料袋呢，傑瑞？
llm_reason: Appropriate colloquial translation preserving core meaning.

src: Ha—not drink. Do. Better things to do.
mt: 哈，不喝酒，還有更要緊的事情要做。

src: And Jerry loves being in Germany, even if he does only know a couple of phrases—Mein name ist Henry, because Henry is who they think he is. Henry Cutter.
mt: 傑瑞喜歡待在德國，即使他只知道幾個短語，「MeinNameistHenry」（我的名字叫亨利），他就是他們念念不忘的亨利·卡特。

src: You are planning on cutting back before the wedding —if you’re going to forget Eva’s name when you’re giving her away at the altar, you’d rather it be from dementia than from being a raging drunk.
mt: 你打算在婚禮到來之前削減酒量，如果在婚禮上把伊娃交到新郎手上時忘記她的名字，你寧願這是因為老年痴呆症，也不願是因為爛醉如泥。

src: No doubt the party became more raucous once the old-timers had gone, that Rick and his friends drunk their way along to a strip joint, but for you it was just dinner and no wine but water, some overcooked chicken, and a soggy salad.
mt: 不過一旦長輩不在場了，派對就變得更加熱鬧。瑞克和他的朋友們都喝高了，派對幾乎變成了脫衣舞俱樂部。不過對你來說，這隻是一頓晚飯而已，你沒有飲酒，只是喝了點水，吃了些雞肉和沙拉。
llm_reason: Accurate and appropriate literary translation with contextual flavor.

src: Summer is approaching and the days are getting longer, and you need to enjoy every sunset that you can now because you never know when it will be your last—at least the last one you’re conscious of.
mt: 夏天將至，白日越來越漫長，你想欣賞每一抹殘陽，因為你永遠不知道什麼時候會是你最後一次欣賞它，至少趁你還有意識的時候要好好欣賞。

src: By the way, you have a hiding place in your office—no, not under the desk—and that’s not a hiding place anymore since Sandra knows about it, but there’s another one at the back of the cupboard. There’s a false wall in there.
mt: 順便說一句，你的寫作房裡有一個暗室，不是指桌子下面的，因為桑德拉已經發現了，而是說柜子後面的那塊牆壁是一面假牆。

src: “This whole time everybody thought I was sick, but it was just Eric all along.”
mt: 「你們每個人都以為我生病了，但那都是艾瑞克——」

src: “Calm down,” Hans says, and he checks his mirror, he indicates, and then he turns the corner and parks on the side of a quieter street in the shade.
mt: 「冷靜一下。」漢斯說。他看了一眼鏡子，然後驅車轉了個彎，在一條安靜的街道上把車停在路邊的林蔭處。

src: So here’s the thing—you just can’t face a support group. Meeting all these folks who are going to forget you at the same rate you forget them— the rate of forgetting twice as fast in reality, like two trains speeding in opposite directions.
mt: 所以，問題來了：你不肯參加互助小組，不想去見一群你終將忘掉的陌生人，何況他們也終將忘掉你，你們彼此相互遺忘，遺忘的速度變成了兩倍，就像兩列火車向著相反的方向疾馳駛離。

src: “Right.” “SIM cards come with the phone numbers written on the sides of the packet. Where’s the packet, Jerry?
mt: 「電話卡的電話號碼常寫在包裝袋的兩邊，包裝袋在哪兒，傑瑞？

src: Now, I’ve told you what happened and I’ve been friendly about it, but now my patience is wearing thin.
mt: 現在，我已經告訴你們發生的一切了，我已經夠配合的了，但現在我快沒有耐心了。

src: If the police couldn’t find it, how did he?”
mt: 要是連警察都找不到，他是怎麼拿到的？」

src: Is there anything else you’re not telling me?”
mt: 我，你是不是還有別的什麼事瞞著我？」

src: He knows every shape, every flaw, he knows where the floorboards creak, what doors squeak, and he knows where the secrets are buried.
mt: 他熟悉這裏的每一個形狀、每一處缺陷，他知道踩在哪裡的地板、開合哪扇門時會吱吱作響，他知道秘密藏在哪裡，知道那塊隱秘的密室。

src: You climbed through the window and lay down on the couch and thought about what had just happened, and wondered if there would be other times you would think you were one of your characters.
mt: 你通過窗戶爬進房屋，躺在沙發上，回想起剛才發生的一幕幕，心裏琢磨著自己會不會還想著把自己當作書中的角色。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: When he looks back at Hans he sees his friend looking annoyed, and for a moment, the briefest of moments, there is something in Hans’s face, something that reminds Jerry that Hans always seemed to know the dark side even better than his darkest characters. Then Hans smiles.
mt: 他回頭看看漢斯，漢斯很是惱火，有那麼一個瞬間，漢斯臉上露出一個怪異的表情，這表情在提醒傑瑞，漢斯是了解黑暗的一面的，比他塑造的最陰險、最惡毒的人物都要了解。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: “We’ve been charting the progression of the disease, Jerry,” Goodstory says.
mt: 「我們一直在關注疾病的進展情況，傑瑞。」

src: “I didn’t say I was. I said somebody wants me to think I am.”
mt: 「我沒有說我是，我是說有人希望我覺得我自己是。」

src: “But won’t he just tell us what we want to hear if we do that?
mt: 「要是我們這樣做了，他就告訴我們想聽的一切，那該怎麼辦？

src: There are retreating footsteps as the men head back to their car.
mt: 腳步聲響了起來，兩個男人走回自己的車。
llm_reason: Accurately captures the action and context.

src: You’ve known all along that the birthday party was a rehearsal for the wedding, a test to see what you can and can’t do, and you passed.
mt: 你已經知道生日派對其實是為婚禮排練的，派對是個測試，看你能做什麼，又不能做什麼。你通過了，也許一切都會一帆風順的。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary enhancement.

src: It took them three hours in the end, and then they showed you and Sandra how everything worked, but you didn’t pay much attention because you were in your Who gives a shit phase, and why not?
mt: 他們花了三個小時幹完活，然後他們給你和桑德拉示範各個裝置都是怎麼運作的，但你沒太在意，因為你正處在「誰他媽在乎」階段。為什麼要在乎？

src: “I think so.”
mt: 「我想有吧。」

src: “About when I used to bring you here as a kid,” he tells her. “The seagulls used to scare you.
mt: 「我在想，你小的時候，我經常帶你來這兒玩，你那時很害怕海鷗。」

src: But those are my words,” Jerry says, pointing at the manuscript. “Not all of them, not whatever is stringing the plot together, but some of them. Somehow Eric got hold of it.”
mt: 傑瑞說著指指手稿，「不是所有的原話，不是所有的情節，只是其中一些被艾瑞克採用了。」

src: You shook a lot of hands, said How have you been a few dozen times, Nice to see you again a few dozen more, people who were strangers, people from your life you couldn’t remember, here was Jerry with his Alzheimer’s, Jerry to be pitied, Jerry who everybody was worried was going to mess up, and isn’t that just the setup to the world’s greatest punch line?
mt: 你和他們一一握手，說了幾十次「您好」，幾十次「很高興再次見到您」。其中有很多人你從來沒見過，還有很多人你記不起來了，站在這裏的是患有阿爾茨海默病的傑瑞，值得被同情的傑瑞，大家都擔心會把事情搞砸的傑瑞，這是不是天底下最好笑的笑話？這就是他們想要的嗎？
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation preserving core meaning.

src: You taught Mrs. Busybody across the road a lesson today, Future Henry.
mt: 未來的亨利，今天你給了街道對面的好管閑事的太太一個教訓。

src: “Shut up,” Hans says, and he takes the gun out of Jerry’s hand but keeps it pointing at him.
mt: 「閉嘴。」漢斯說，他從傑瑞手裡奪過槍，指著他。

src: Genuine laughter, especially from the older folks in the crowd who all can relate to what Jerry is saying.
mt: 特別是人群中的老人們，他們都能理解傑瑞說的意思。

src: “The biggest piece of advice I give people is write what you know, and fake the rest.
mt: 「我給人們最多的建議就是：寫下你知道的，其餘的都可以編造。

src: The room darkens as his legs weaken.
mt: 他雙腿癱軟，房間里正一寸一寸變暗。

src: The main character is keeping a Madness Journal. The main character’s name is Gerald Black, and Gerald has no idea how long he’s been in the home. However, Gerald’s words sound exactly like Jerry’s. In fact so much like Jerry’s own words that he knows they are his own.
mt: 主角的名字是傑拉爾德·布萊克，傑拉爾德不知道自己在療養院住了多久，可傑拉爾德說的話完全像是出自傑瑞之口，就是傑瑞自己說的話，他知道那些話是他說的。

src: You got the amazing wife, a woman who can put her hand in yours and make you feel whatever it is you need to feel, whether it’s comfort or warmth or excitement or lust, the woman who you wake up to every morning knowing you get to fall asleep with her that night, the woman who can always see the other side of the argument, the woman who teaches you more about life every day.
mt: 你曾娶了一位賢良淑德的妻子，她能將自己的手義無反顧地放在你的手掌里，能填滿你所有的欲求——無論是懷抱的舒適、臂膀里的溫暖還是魚水之歡。每個夜晚，你們同床共枕；每個清晨，你們雙雙醒來。即便是爭論，她也總會站在你的角度為你著想。她能讓你發現生活的另一面。
llm_reason: Accurate and poetic literary translation preserving core meaning.

src: “Did I do these things?
mt: 「我殺了人嗎？
llm_reason: Appropriate colloquial translation preserving core meaning.

src: They head into what turns out to be the dining room, then the lounge, no furniture to bang their knees into.
mt: 他們走進餐廳，接著是客廳，沒有傢具磕碰他們的膝蓋。

src: You said write what you know and fake the rest. You said throw some research in there too.”
mt: 你說寫熟悉的東西，剩下的可以虛構，但也需要做些研究。」

src: The door being unlocked, that was a sign and I took it.
mt: 門沒有鎖，這是一個徵兆，而我充分地把握住了它。

src: Sandra didn’t believe you. Sandra offered them her keys, and there was nothing you could think to do as the officers went to the front door.
mt: 桑德拉不相信，她把鑰匙給了他們，警察朝前門走去，你慌得不知所措。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: You miss the way Hans used to be, but the old Hans wouldn’t have driven off and returned with all that Bombay Sapphire.
mt: 你雖然懷念以前的漢斯，但以前的漢斯絕不會驅車離去，回來時給你帶孟買產的藍寶石金酒。

src: He’s heavier and stronger and younger and madder and he pushes her easily back down the pathway.
mt: 他更重、更強壯、更年輕、更瘋狂一些，他輕而易舉地把她推回到小路上。

src: “Okay,” Jerry says. “And once we find it, we read it, and we go to the police no matter what it says, okay?”
mt: 「一旦我們找到了它，就要好好讀讀，然後去警察局，不管那上面寫些什麼，好嗎？」

src: Jerry thinks about the woman on the lounge floor, the bruises and the blood. He thinks about her eyes open and staring at him.
mt: 傑瑞回想著那個躺在客廳地板上的女人，她身上的瘀傷和血跡，那雙圓瞪著的盯著他的眼睛。

src: The plan had been to dump it into a deep hole forever, but now the plan was changing. Evolving.
mt: 原計劃是把它丟進一個深洞的，但現在計劃變了。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: In the afternoon she took you suit shopping.
mt: 當天下午她帶你去買衣服了。

src: “You think some of that belongs to the girls?”
mt: 「你認為這些屬於那些女孩嗎？」
llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation of the question.

src: Useful Jerry. That’s who he is now.
mt: 傑瑞還是有利用價值的，這就是現在的他。

src: On the wall is the line from Fahrenheit 451. He walks over and touches the frame holding it. “It took some man a lifetime maybe to put some of his thoughts down, looking around at the world and life, and then I came along in two minutes and boom!
mt: 牆壁上是一段《華氏451度》引言，他走了過去，撫摸著邊框：「有些人需用畢生的時間記錄自己的思想，他們需要審視周圍的世界和生活，而我用兩分鐘時間就能搞定！

src: “It’s almost just how you left it,” Terrance says.
mt: 「跟您離開時沒什麼兩樣。」特倫斯說。

src: When I try to think of these people, their names and faces all fade into a murky past, but not hers.
mt: 當我回想這些人時，他們的名字和面孔都消失在陰暗的過去，唯獨她的沒有。

src: He parked outside the old house and Jerry came walking down the pathway to the car with that stupid dopey look Jerry has these days.
mt: 他把車停在老房子的外面，傑瑞沿著小徑迎面走來，獃頭獃腦的。

src: A little tired, maybe, but that’s all. You actually went out to dinner last night with Sandra —in all your years since being married, you’ve always had at least one date night every month—and you both spoke about books, and movies, what was happening in the news, what some of your friends were up to.
mt: 昨晚，你與桑德拉一同外出吃了頓晚飯——結婚多年，你們仍舊保持著每個月的某晚出去約會的習慣——你們倆談論圖書、電影、新聞、朋友。

src: “Here, the books are just here,” he says, and he strips them away from the top shelf of the bookcase and puts them on the desk, the thirteen of them forming two piles, thirteen plots and thirteen sets of characters Jerry can barely remember, the thirteenth of which he barely wrote.
mt: 說著他從書櫃頂層取下書來，擺放在桌子上。十三本書擺成兩排，十三段情節，十三個人物，傑瑞幾乎都不記得了。第十三本書還是他勉強寫就的。

src: He thinks, he thinks, how did life get to this point?
mt: 他在想自己怎麼會淪落到這步田地了？

src: Of course she’s been around a lot since then, and a lot has happened.
mt: 從那天起她常常過來，其間還發生了許多事情。

src: Say nothing. Who knows, in another month or two maybe you’ll have forgotten all about this.
mt: 再過一兩個月也許你會忘記這一切的。

src: He doesn’t look at the book. He doesn’t do anything but stare at her, and then he closes his eyes and he wonders how life has gotten this way.
mt: 他沒有看書，也沒看別的，只是死死瞪著她，隨後閉上了眼睛。

src: I wish I had somebody in my life who was even a tenth of the woman Sandra is.
mt: 我一生中要是能遇到一個及桑德拉十分之一的女人就知足了。

src: The officer against the wall shifts his position by crossing his arms the other way.
mt: 倚牆而立的警察換了一種姿勢交叉雙臂。

src: Or disprove.
mt: 「或者，你也可以反證。

src: When asked, he said, So the dementia, that means you’re going to start saying all sorts of shit to people, right? You told him that was so.
mt: 你問他時，他說：「老年痴獃，就意味著你對別人說的話都是屁話，對吧？」

src: This time his fingers close on the journal.
mt: 這一次，他的指尖觸碰到日記了。

src: He puts his hands on it and closes his eyes, hoping when he opens them he’ll be back in time, that coming here has been a doorway into his past not just in memory but in reality. It doesn’t work out that way.
mt: 他希望再睜開眼時他能及時回來，他來這裏，是要回到現實中的過去，而不是記憶中的過去，那樣肯定是行不通的。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: You used to go to his flat to study, and often the TV or the computer or the toaster would be in pieces, and once he figured out how all that stuff ticked, he moved on to bigger things, like the car.
mt: 他喜歡探索事情的來龍去脈，那時你常去他的公寓學習，公寓里的電視、電腦或烤麵包機都被他拆得七零八落，一旦他摸清了這些小東西的構造，他就把目光投向更龐大的東西，比如汽車。

src: He based this book on what happened to her. He used her story to write one of his own, a story he then went on to sell, a story that helped pay his mortgage, that helped give Eva a good education, a story that gave them the chance to travel the world—all things that couldn’t have been any further from Suzan’s mind when her ex-boyfriend’s hands were around her throat.
mt: 他把她當成原型，把那場謀殺當成情節寫進了這本書，然後拿去售賣，支付抵押貸款，提供伊娃一流的教育，給他們一家週遊世界的機會——當蘇姍的前男友扼住她喉嚨的時候，恐怕她永遠也想不到會有這一天。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary adaptation.

src: The man just says Jerry, which means it must be somebody he liked enough to have given his real name to, but with just the one word he can’t tell how good the man’s English is.
mt: 這個人居然稱他「傑瑞」，說明他很喜歡他，不然他不會透露自己的真名的。只憑一個單詞，他還不能判斷他的英文怎樣。

src: The key was to make Jerry try to hide the evidence, which would only serve to make him look guiltier.
mt: 因此他得讓傑瑞隱藏證據，這隻會使他看起來更有罪。

src: Jerry can see his friend’s mind racing.
mt: 傑瑞可以看到他的朋友的腦子裡的齒輪在飛轉。
llm_reason: Accurate literary translation with appropriate metaphor.

src: That’s her, Sandra said, and she sounded pleased you remembered.
mt: 「就是她。」桑德拉說。因為你還記得，她顯得很高興。

src: I haven’t told you yet, but I wrote in my journal that there is a second hiding place!”
mt: 我還沒有告訴你，但我在日記中寫著，還有第二個暗格或者密室！」

src: If anything he might have to start yelling just to get his point across.
mt: 如果有什麼事值得他聲嘶力竭地大喊，也只是為了清晰明朗地表達自己。

src: Sandra asked what to do about Mrs. Smith. You made the joke about hiring a hit man, but she didn’t laugh.
mt: 桑德拉問怎麼處理史密斯太太的事，你開玩笑地說雇一個職業殺手吧，但她沒有笑，也許這真的不好笑。

src: Jerry crouches down and works at the floorboard with the screwdriver, digging it in just enough to lift the board and get his fingers under it.
mt: 傑瑞蹲下來，用螺絲刀撬地板，他把地板磚掀開，將手指伸進去。

src: Sometimes on the days I remember who I am, I wonder if it’s the writing that made me this way—all those crazy people running around inside my head—some of that crazy was bound to rub off on me, wasn’t it?
mt: 所以我在想是不是因為寫作才讓我變成了這樣：因為那些瘋狂的人物都在我的腦海里翻騰著，所以有些瘋狂的想法會傳染給我，不是嗎？

src: he asks her a minute later.
mt: 一分鐘后他問。

src: He looks at the cover, at the smiley face Eva drew, the eyes glued to the cover, one of them foggy, one of them clear.
mt: 他把它拿在手上，看著封面，上面是伊娃畫的笑臉，眼睛是粘上去的，一個霧蒙蒙的，另一個很清晰。

src: I killed him, and in a way I hope it helps balance the scales for the others.
mt: 我殺了他，在某種程度上，我希望這可以將功贖罪。

src: “You ever have characters who commit a crime and then can’t remember doing it?”
mt: 「你書里有沒有人犯了罪，結果自己反而不記得了？」

src: She must be in her midtwenties, maybe even thirty. She smells like soap.
mt: 她有二十五六歲，或者三十了，渾身散發著肥皂的氣息。

src: Well, that’s what they are here to prove.
mt: 好了，他們就是這樣來證明的。

src: “You’re rotten inside, Mr. Grey. Mean to the core.”
mt: 「你爛透了，格雷先生，我是說你心腸爛透了。」

src: “I . . . I couldn’t have done it. Any of it.”
mt: 「我……我不可能做這件事的，任何事都不會做。」

src: “I killed somebody,” he says, and there—the words are in the open for Nurse Hamilton to do with them what she shall.
mt: 「我殺了人。」他說。當這句話脫口而出時，漢密爾頓護士完全可以按自己的方式應對。

src: “Look at where we are, Jerry. Look at the situation we’re in. You’re lucky the taxi driver earlier didn’t figure out who you were. You’re a wanted man who is running out of time, and if you’re to be believed, an innocent man.
mt: 「看看我們現在落到什麼境地了，傑瑞，你很幸運早些時候計程車司機沒有認出你是誰，你可是一個被警方通緝的人。

src: Nothing good ever comes after those words.
mt: 那些話后准沒什麼好事。

src: You were home by ten and are keeping your promise to ride the sober train all the way to Eva’s wedding.
mt: 你到家時已經十點了，你保證過要一直保持清醒，直到伊娃舉行完婚禮。

src: You should use that in one of your books,” Mayor says.
mt: 你也應該在你的書中用用這個橋段。」

src: “Then what do you mean?” “Just lately. All the bad stuff lately is because of him.”
mt: 「最近，最近所有糟糕的事情都是因他而起。」

src: He figures he can kill four women. The first three, he dumps the writer at random locations, but on the fourth he leaves him inside the house to wake up and get his prints and DNA all over the place, which is what happens, and the writer thinks he’s done it.”
mt: 他覺得他可以殺死四個女人，前三次，他隨便把作家丟棄在某個地方，但在第四次，他把他丟到一幢房子里，到處留下他的指紋和DNA，這就是真相，所以作家以為是他做的。」
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: To Jerry he looks like a human baked potato.
mt: 在傑瑞眼裡，他像個烤土豆。

src: “Just yesterday, when we went to look for the journal.
mt: 「就是昨天，我們去找日記的時候。

src: “I don’t . .
mt: 「我不……

src: You know what further down the line means—it’s going to be just like when she read the journal. She’s going to tell you that you’ve agreed all along to selling the place and that you’ve forgotten.
mt: 你知道「以後」意味著什麼，就像她讀日記一樣，她會在「以後」告訴你，你同意賣掉這所房子，你只是忘記罷了。

src: They turn him so his back is to the window.
mt: 他們把他轉了個身，所以現在他背對窗外。

src: It was the day you were trying to dump the can of spray-paint.
mt: 就是在那一天，你打算丟掉噴漆罐。

src: They move quickly across the backyard, where the lawn is ankle deep and the surrounding garden is overrun with stinging nettle and weeds big enough to have developed inch-thick trunks.
mt: 他們飛速穿過後院，那裡的草長到了腳踝，花園四周長滿蕁麻和雜草，每一株都長得像一英寸粗的樹榦。

src: While you said it Sandra had her own words that she said over and over, and hers were, What have you done, Jerry, what have you done?
mt: 你在說話時桑德拉也在說，一遍又一遍地說，她說的是：「你做了什麼？傑瑞，你做了什麼？」

src: If only it were so simple (yet in a way it is. If I don’t write it down, it will become easy for you to forget.
mt: （但在某種程度上，是的，如果我不寫下來，你很容易就會忘掉。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: You sat there pretending not to notice the whispered comments and not-so-subtle nods in your direction.
mt: 你坐在那裡假裝沒有注意到那些竊竊私語、評頭論足，或沖你這邊那些微妙的點頭。

src: He heads to the sporting store he passed a minute earlier. He spends half of his remaining cash on an overpriced rugby cap (go All Blacks!) and tugs it tightly over his head and tucks the front of it down a little.
mt: 他向一分鐘之前經過的那家體育商店走去，用剩餘現金的一半買了頂標價很高的橄欖球帽（全黑色），牢牢地套在頭頂，並把帽檐使勁向下拉。

src: Jerry’s anger subsides as he thinks about it, then his heart starts to race with the possibility. There could be some answers in here.
mt: 傑瑞思忖著，他的怒火平息下來，察覺到有這種可能，他的心跳開始加速，問題的答案會在後文中。

src: It was a self-fulfilling prophecy, the wedding ruined for no other reason than because everybody, including yourself, believed you were going to ruin it.
mt: 你這是自證預言，婚禮被毀了，沒有別的原因，只是因為包括你自己在內的所有人都認定你要毀掉婚禮。

src: Today’s field reporter has the look of a working-class man, sleeves rolled up and no tie, and that makes the news far more real, so jaw-droppingly urgent this man didn’t have time to put on a jacket or a tie or even shave.
mt: 今天到場的記者看起來很像工薪族，袖子卷著，沒打領帶，這使新聞顯得更加真實。好像因為情況緊迫，這人沒空穿外套打領帶，甚至連鬍子都沒刮就跑了過來。

src: My parents always told me not to talk to strangers, and that’s what you guys are, right?
mt: 我的父母總是告訴我不要和陌生人說話，說的就是你們這些人，明白嗎？

src: He tries to think about where else he could have hidden the journal, and there’s something there, a memory like a splinter in his brain that he can’t quite get to, but instead of focusing on that, he thinks about Eric.
mt: 他在想還有可能把日記藏在別的什麼地方，他大腦中的記憶就像碎片一般難以拼湊，而且他也難以集中精力，因為總是想著艾瑞克。

src: He finds what he’s looking for. Not quite what he’s looking for—there’s vodka, and no gin, but it will have to do.
mt: 他找到了，卻不是他想要的：裏面有伏特加，但沒有杜松子酒，但也聊勝於無了。

src: All those things you write about, and now with the Alzheimer’s messing with you, you’re calling me the insane one?”
mt: 你寫了所有東西，現在你又得了阿爾茨海默病，你說我是瘋子？」

src: The same way he’s able to predict the ending to nearly every movie and TV show he’s seen, the same way he knows what’s waiting for him on the last page of any novel.
mt: 他可以預測他看過的每部電影和電視劇的結局，同樣，他也可以預測任何一部小說最後一頁寫的收場。

src: You don’t remember shooting her, is it possible you didn’t?
mt: 你不記得開槍把她打死，是不是有可能根本就不是你乾的？

src: Jerry pictures the day being split into three parts; the sun is out towards the west and looks like it’ll be gone in a few hours, making him decide they’re nearing the end of the second act.
mt: 傑瑞想象著，如果將一整天分成三幕，此刻斜陽西沉，不久就將隱沒于天際，那麼他們正處在第二幕的尾聲。

src: Everything had gone off without a hitch—even Jerry had walked his daughter down the aisle perfectly, the right pacing, the right smile, the right amount of pressure on her arm as hers interlocked his.
mt: 一切都進行得十分順利，甚至傑瑞挽著女兒走過甬道的那一幕也無可挑剔，有序的步伐、得體的笑容，挽著女兒手臂的力道也剛好。

src: Time.
mt: 時間。

src: “It’s not progress,” Jerry says. “It’s the exact opposite of progress. It’s . . . is there a word for that?”
mt: 「不是進步，」傑瑞說，「恰恰是進步的反義詞，是……有一個什麼詞來著？」

src: “Let’s blame the writer.
mt: 「那我們就控訴作家們去吧。

src: I don’t mean remember it, but feel it . . . in your bones somehow?”
mt: 我的意思不是記住，而是感覺……在你內心深處？」
llm_reason: Accurate literary translation with appropriate tone and nuance.

src: Before she can answer, Jerry opens the door, and when she grabs his arm this time he shrugs it off.
mt: 還沒等她回答，傑瑞就打開車門。她抓住他的胳膊，這一次他掙脫開了。

src: “My guess is that evidence is already on its way back to the station and in about fifteen minutes they’re going to be fingerprinting everything and about fifteen minutes after that they’re going to have your name.
mt: 漢斯說，「我猜測證據已經在來警局的路上了，他們會在十五分鐘內進行指紋識別，十五分鐘后他們將知道你的名字。

src: But of course Captain A had something else in mind, didn’t he?
mt: 但是，「阿爾茨船長」心中肯定會有別的想法，不是嗎？

src: Completely. And utterly. Alone.
mt: 完全地、徹底地、孤零零地獨自一人。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation of emphasis and solitude.

src: You called me because you think I can help you get away with murder. Just like you did last time.
mt: 你打電話叫我來，只是因為你覺得我可以幫你逃脫法網，就像上一次那樣嗎？

src: “It’s,” he says, gasping for breath, “your fault.
mt: 他喘著氣說：「這是……你的錯。是，你的，錯。」
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: She actually knocked before coming in, which is something she always used to do before opening the door, which always made your job feel so formal for lack of a better word.
mt: 她進來時，甚至還敲了敲門，她每次開門前總是要敲敲門，這總是讓你感覺很「正式」，有時你甚至找不到恰當的字眼來形容這件事。

src: “Yeah, yeah, I heard you, but you’re not making any sense.”
mt: 「是啊，是的，我聽見你說話了，但是，你究竟想說什麼？」

src: You’re going to use this . . . this stupid disease as an excuse for everything now, aren’t you?
mt: 你打算一直用這個愚蠢的疾病為一切事情開脫，是嗎？

src: “I don’t make those decisions,” Jerry says.
mt: 「我不負責做這些決定。」

src: “Jesus, you look like somebody just walked all over your grave,” Hans says.
mt: 「天哪，你看上去像是有人經過了你的墳墓。」漢斯說。

src: Then you’ll have to wear a goddamn magnetic collar to make sure the other dementia granddads on the street don’t wander in and raid the fridge and shit on the carpet and chew up the arms of the lounge set.
mt: 你得戴上一個該死的項圈，確保街上其他患有痴呆症的老爺爺不會闖進來，然後搶劫冰箱、在地毯上拉屎、破壞客廳里的傢具。

src: There is more tapping, which is then followed by more silence.
mt: 拍打的聲音在持續，接著是更長時間的沉默。

src: You don’t know which version of Jerry made that decision, or which version of Jerry showed up at the florist where Belinda works.
mt: 你不知道哪個時段的傑瑞會做出上述的哪種決定，或者哪個時段的傑瑞會出現在貝琳達的花店中。

src: I’ve been telling people—telling and really insisting—that I kept a woman locked in my basement for two weeks before killing her, which would be a really neat trick since I’ve never owned a house with a basement.
mt: 我一直在對人們說——一直在堅持地說——我把一個女人鎖在我的地下室里兩個星期，然後殺死了她。這確實是瞎話，因為我根本就沒有帶地下室的房子。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: Not in your neighborhood, hell, not even in your suburb.”
mt: 你家附近也沒有，甚至連郊區也沒有。」

src: Hans says nothing for a while. He just stares at Jerry, and Jerry can see Hans’s mind unlocking the problem, the way he always has.
mt: 一時間，漢斯陷入了沉默，只是盯著傑瑞，傑瑞可以看到漢斯的大腦正在層層撥開這個謎團，他總有辦法的。

src: Sandra rang her this morning and told her you’d gone a-wandering, which was something the counselor said was likely to happen.
mt: 今天上午桑德拉給她打電話說你又出去遊盪了，諮詢師說這的確是會發生的。

src: A recurring character who could be at work, or on his way here.
mt: 他此刻可能正在上班，或者在來這裏的路上。

src: “So that night on the longest day of the year I went into her house at three o’clock in the morning with a knife so I could scratch it.”
mt: 「那真是一年中最漫長的一個夜晚，我在凌晨三點鐘走進她家，手裡握著一把刀，這樣我就可以剜掉這塊痒痒肉。」
llm_reason: Accurate and literary translation with appropriate idiomatic expression.

src: If they don’t shoot you when they find you, then there’ll be a trial, one that Eva will have to sit through and learn all the awful things you’ve done, and then they’re going to make a big show out of executing you, because that’s what they’re going to do, Jerry.”
mt: 如果他們抓到你，就算不打死你，也會對你進行審訊，伊娃會備受煎熬，去聽審訊，知曉你所做的那些可怕的事情，然後他們會公開處決你。後果不堪設想，傑瑞。」
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary translation.

src: He watches the people and the traffic and stares at the buildings, Christchurch City on a spring day and if there’s a more beautiful city in the world he hasn’t seen it, and he has seen a lot of cities—that’s one thing the writing has given him, it’s given him freedom and . . .
mt: 透過車窗，他凝視著外面如織的人潮與車流，凝視著一幢幢房屋與高樓，凝望著春天裡的克萊斯特徹奇市，這座世界上最美麗的城市。他曾去過很多城市——是寫作給了他這樣的機會，給了他這般自由……

src: “There was an orderly there too. They had to sedate me.
mt: 「還有一個護理員，他們得讓我鎮靜下來。

src: They already think I killed somebody, and I’m not talking about Sandra.”
mt: 他們已經認定我殺人了，我不是在說桑德拉。」
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: Hans unlocks the window, then has to shoulder it upwards because it’s swollen in the damp air.
mt: 漢斯打開窗戶，但是他必須用力向上托，因為空氣潮濕致使窗戶都走樣變形了。

src: He wonders why that could be. Perhaps he didn’t mention it before because he didn’t want to know. Perhaps enough of him remembered that it was best he forget. Only now he needs to know.
mt: 他不明白這是為什麼，也許他之前沒有提到它是因為他不想知道，或者他覺得記住還不如忘了，只是現在他需要知道了。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: And if you didn’t remember, you’d feel it in your bones.”
mt: 如果你不記得，你內心也會感覺到的。」

src: “Damn it, Jerry, I know that, okay?
mt: 「媽的，傑瑞，我知道好嗎？

src: Day One, the opening words, and there was Jerry talking to himself, Jerry sounding just like . . . well, just like Jerry.
mt: 第一天是開場白，傑瑞在自言自語，看上去就像是……好吧，還是像傑瑞。

src: Even now you don’t know what you could have done or said to stop the officers opening your door, but you suspect that Past Jerry, even one as recent as a month ago, would have known.
mt: 現在你也不知道應該怎樣做或說些什麼才能阻止警察去開門，但你猜過去的傑瑞，哪怕是一個月前的傑瑞也會知道的。

src: Jerry knows what’s going on—he’s put enough fictional people into this situation before to know they’ll let him sweat in here for a while, before hitting him with a round of good cop, bad cop.
mt: 傑瑞知道接下來將要發生什麼，他曾為許多書中人物設計過眼前的場景，他知道他們會讓他在這裏待上一會兒，出出汗，好警察和壞警察們將會輪番上場，給他以震懾。

src: This is day ten of the Madness Journal. Sorry it’s not so regular, but life and the things that go along with it (that you’ll soon start to forget) keep getting in the way.
mt: 這是「狂人日記」的第十天，對不起，寫得不太有規律，但生活不也是這樣毫無規律地進行著嗎（不過你會很快忘記的）？
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: At the moment they’re stressing about the flowers.
mt: 他們眼下正在關注鮮花的問題。

src: “I think Henry tore them out.”
mt: 「我想是亨利撕掉的。」

src: Please, hear me out. As my friend, listen to me.”
mt: 請聽我說完，我的朋友，聽我說。」

src: Are you really my daughter?” he asks, and he thinks about his daughter, his Eva, but now that he’s thinking about it, Eva is ten years old, not twentysomething, and his daughter would be calling him Dad, not Jerry.
mt: 你真的是我女兒？」他問。隨後他想起來了，他的伊娃，只不過伊娃才十歲，不是二十來歲。他的女兒會叫他「爸爸」，而不會直呼其名，叫他「傑瑞」。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with correct meaning.

src: They get twenty yards before having to stop at a red light.
mt: 他們開了二十米，在紅燈前停了下來。

src: “It just doesn’t, Jerry,” she says, using a tone that lets him know she doesn’t want to discuss it.
mt: 「就是沒用，傑瑞。」她故意流露出這種不想跟他討論的腔調，好讓他知難而退。

src: “Isn’t that obvious?”
mt: 「這不明擺著的嗎？」

src: Then he sees it—a park bench right where lawn meets tree. He makes his way over and sits down.
mt: 後來他發現一個好去處，那就是樹林和草地交接處的公園長椅。

src: “You want to discuss the way I live, or what we’re going to do about your situation?”
mt: 「你是想來討論我生活的方式，還是來處理你的事？」

src: “What would it take, do you think, to get away with murder?”
mt: 梅厄問，「你認為需要怎麼樣，罪人才能逃脫法網？」

src: Hard to know whether it’s crashing what’s left of my career or helping it.
mt: 不知道這是否會毀掉我的事業，還是幫助我更加飛黃騰達。

src: He doesn’t believe her—why would he? She’s just a stranger. Still . . .
mt: 他不相信她的話，他為什麼……她不過是個陌生人。

src: He remembers it was close, but can’t remember when that was. Last year? Two years ago?
mt: 他記得這事兒就發生在最近，但不記得確切的日子，去年還是兩年前？

src: Jerry grabs his plastic bag and Hans flicks on the garage light so Jerry can follow without walking into a lawn mower or shelf. They head into the house.
mt: 傑瑞拿起購物袋，漢斯打開車庫裡的燈，這樣傑瑞就可以跟上他，不至於碰到割草機或儲物架。

src: Every open homicide is going to close with my name in the whodunit box.”
mt: 每一起凶殺案都會以我的名字為兇犯結案。」

src: You owe them at least that.
mt: 至少，這是你欠他們的。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: He showed you the new tattoo around the base of his neck, just below the collar line so he had to pull his T-shirt down a little, and there in finger-sized lettering were the words The Cutting Man.
mt: 他給你展示了一下脖子上的新文身，比衣服領口要低一點兒，所以他得把短袖往下拉一拉，只見上面文著指甲大小的「刀鋒狂人」。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate idiomatic expression.

src: He starts to cry, because he remembers it then—his room, the nurses, the gardens, sitting in the sun with only his sense of loss as company.
mt: 他哭了起來，因為他終於回想起了當時的情形——他的房間、護士、花園，他一個人悵然若失地坐在陽光下，形影相弔。

src: You were with Mae for several hours, Sandra told you.
mt: 「你跟梅在一塊兒待了好幾個小時。」

src: You rang me earlier and I came and picked you up from a shopping mall.
mt: 你之前打電話給我，我來了，在一家商場接你。

src: You thought about lying, but what was the point?
mt: 你想過撒謊，但究竟說什麼好呢？
llm_reason: Appropriate colloquial translation preserving core meaning.

src: He sits back down as the wedding footage ends and then it’s back to today’s crime scene, cops moving around in the background, somebody in a suit carrying a fat metal briefcase, somebody with a camera hanging around their neck while they reach into a bag for a different lens.
mt: 婚禮錄像結束后，他坐了回去。電視畫面重新顯示著今天的案發現場，警察在來回走動，一個穿西裝的男人背著個有金屬配飾的公文包，另一些脖子上掛著相機的記者正在包里摸索著鏡頭。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate details.

src: “Pen name?”
mt: 「筆名？」

src: The blanks will be filled in soon, but basically Eva and Rick have set an earlier date for the wedding to make sure you’re able to participate.
mt: 上面的空白頁會補上的。伊娃和瑞克已經將婚禮提前了，這樣確保你能參加。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: He’s a morning person and has never slept past ten o’clock in his life. It can’t be much later than ten o’clock now.
mt: 他是一個習慣早起的人，從來沒有超過十點鐘起床，所以現在肯定沒過十點。

src: It’s time to sneak out the window, maybe find a bar somewhere and just . . .
mt: 現在你需要偷偷爬到窗外，找一間酒吧，只是在那裡小坐一會兒。

src: “Is she though?” he asks.
mt: 「可是，她是不是……」他問。

src: The theme of struggling in the morning after waking up also extends to naps. Often you’ll take an afternoon nap, and when you wake up you’ll be confused, yet that tends to only last a few minutes. Sometimes much less than that, fifteen minutes at the most, then you become alert again.”
mt: 你通常會午睡，醒來后你的意識也會變得混沌，也會對現狀困惑不已，但往往只持續幾分鐘，有時更短，最多一刻鐘，接著你就能清醒過來。」

src: No, you haven’t lost day two and day three—in fact you can remember them clearly (though you did misplace your coffee and Sandra found it out by the pool, which is weird because you don’t even have a pool).
mt: 不，你沒有漏掉第二天和第三天，其實你對這兩天記憶猶新（比如你把咖啡放錯了地方，桑德拉在游泳池邊發現了它，但你明明記得你家根本沒有游泳池啊）。

src: Then it comes. “Let me ask you something else,” Mayor says, and his tone is the same, just casually shooting the breeze. “You ever think that a crime writer could outsmart the police?
mt: 果然，他的問題接踵而來：「我問你一件事，」梅厄說，他的語氣和剛才一樣，如同閑聊一般，「你有沒有想過，犯罪小說家會比警察更聰明？

src: He can’t catch his breath. He’s a fool, a silly fool for wanting to escape the nursing home to prove his innocence because all he’s done is hurt somebody else.
mt: 他就是個傻瓜，一個想逃出療養院證明自己清白的傻瓜，可他所做的一切只是傷害別人。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: Like what?
mt: 「比如呢？」

src: Like what?
mt: 「比如呢？」

src: Jerry shrugs. “Don’t take it personally.”
mt: 傑瑞聳聳肩：「別往心裏去。」

src: “Come on,” she says. “It’s a beautiful spring day.
mt: 她說，「多麼美好的春天啊。

src: Bradbury said, “It took some man a lifetime maybe to put some of his thoughts down, looking around at the world and life, and then I came along in two minutes and boom!

src: Jerry climbs over, landing in a backyard that still feels as though it’s his. Up ahead is where the pool used to be, but now it’s a paved area with a long wooden barbecue table and a pair of outdoor gas heaters. There are no lights on inside the house.

src: That’s what you need. There is some good news because the ceremony itself went off without a hitch, so let’s start there, huh?
mt: 好消息是婚禮儀式本身沒出什麼亂子，所以讓我們從這裏開始說起，好嗎？

src: You were sitting in the office chair looking at the couch wondering if the couch wouldn’t be better for what you had in mind, but it would mean shifting the trash bags and that really was just more stalling. Plus it would ruin the couch.
mt: 你坐在辦公椅上看著沙發，心想坐在沙發上琢磨心事再合適不過了，但這意味著就要挪動垃圾袋，何況這樣做只是拖延時間罷了，說不定還會毀了沙發。

src: “I don’t know. I don’t think so.

mt: 「讓我想想。」他說著，閉上眼睛。他想象著自己坐在寫作房裡，這天是工作日，他寫作的時候就是工作日，周末和平日都一樣，連他生日那天也不休息。

mt: 尼古拉斯是個被指控武裝搶劫的朋克少年，在警局牢房裡他受到毒打、強|暴，差點兒丟掉小命。

src: Maybe he’d get ten yards out there and drown.
mt: 也許他只能游出十米遠，然後溺水而亡。

src: Just don’t let Henry talk you into sneaking out to visit your florist, huh?
mt: 「不要讓亨利誘導你溜出去看花店老闆，行嗎？」

src: “Do the messier ones give you better ideas?”

src: “You mean it’s not at the home?”

src: The wedding itself went okay, but that’s because all the Stand here, Don’t stand here, Walk like this practicing got you through it.

src: “Possible? Anything is possible,” Hans says.

src: Belinda asked if you were okay, and you told her you were, because you really were okay, Future Jerry, you were on a mission, one so top secret even you didn’t know the agenda.
mt: 貝琳達問你好不好，你說你很好。你真的很好，未來的傑瑞，你正擔負著一項使命，這是絕對的機密，哪怕你連日程安排都忘了也不可以泄露出去。

src: Then you got thirsty. Then you excused yourself and went into your office. Then you snuck out the window so you wouldn’t set one of the alarms off and went for a walk, because you should be able to walk, shouldn’t you? And get some fresh air?

src: By stealing a detective’s badge and walking around the crime scene asking questions?

src: You’re going to be snapping at people and saying mean things.

src: Hans uses his phone to light their way back through the house. They don’t say anything as they walk out the front.

src: I murdered my wife. I don’t remember killing her, and I don’t know whether to be grateful for Captain A hiding that from me or not.
mt: 我殺死了我的妻子，但我不記得殺了她，我不知道是否要因為「阿爾茨船長」對我隱瞞了真相而要感謝他。

src: He looked rattled. “I don’t . . . I don’t know where it is,” he said.

src: I’m not sure,” Jerry says, and he isn’t sure.

src: You were standing in the doorway with hair dripping wet even though you had gotten dressed, and then you realized all of you was dripping wet.

src: “Where else would you hide it?”

src: It just, well, it’s just the entire thing.

src: “Not masculine enough?”

mt: 他是傑瑞·格雷，一個犯罪小說家，他只不過是個神志不清的老頭，雖然就他的年齡而言他還稱不上「老」，但阿爾茨海默病已經讓他垂垂老矣。傑瑞·格雷，一個虛構世界的締造者，一個專挑女人的殺手，一個神志不清的瘋子。

src: To distract himself, he tells her about the house, how he found it all those years ago, how he was driving with Sandra to meet a different real estate agent at a different house when they drove past this one with an Open House sign out front, the details as clear in his head as if it were yesterday, making his frustration at forgetting more recent things that much greater.

mt: 「幸運的是」一切都變好了，「幸運的是」你並沒有患上老年痴呆症），現在租了那所房子的女人在是克萊斯特徹奇醫院的護士，她認為你被嚇壞了，變糊塗了，她能察覺現在是誰掌控著你。她讓你進來，告訴你一切都會好起來的。她請你坐下，給你沏了杯茶。

src: He is sitting on a couch in a lounge, just him and the dead girl on the floor, surrounded by nice furniture, nice paintings, all the mod cons of life you can’t take with you. The curtains are closed.

src: He can’t imagine what a real estate agent would say as a selling point—unless they listed it as an ideal home for the budding pyromaniac.

src: “Nosy neighbors,” Hans says.

src: He can see the floor, he can see himself prying up one of the boards with a screwdriver.

src: You preferred it when she sang it, but even so, it’s such a huge thrill.

src: You had visited your lawyer during the week, and your accountant—all these preparations for the future—it’s like you’re taking a trip to the moon and never coming back.

src: “Well dangling him outside the window was a stupid idea.”

src: He has never been here before, he’s sure of it.

src: Be it in the fridge, or in the pantry, or once (hello, irony) by the pool.

src: It wasn’t a wedding shirt anymore, but a funeral shirt, made to look that way by the blood on it.

mt: 漢斯聳聳肩，好像說了這些也沒什麼大不了的。

src: Henry is trying to say something, but he can’t find the words, which is a shame because it feels important.
mt: 亨利想說些什麼，但他找不到合適的字眼，於他而言這是一種恥辱。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary tone.

src: You’ve written twelve books, and number thirteen, The Man Goes Burning, is with your editor at the moment. She’s struggling with it.
mt: 你已經寫了十二本書，第十三本書——《燃燒的男人》——此刻編輯正在絞盡腦汁地奮力審稿當中。

src: “They’ve been injecting you?” he asks, and they’re still in the driveway.
mt: 「他們已經開始給你打針了？」他問，他們仍然在車道上。

src: He flicks to the end of the fledgling writer’s document, hoping there will be some answers, but there is no end.
mt: 他想翻看這位初出茅廬的作家的手稿的結尾，應該會找到答案的，但是並沒有結尾。

src: “Which is?”
mt: 「是什麼？」
llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation of interrogative.

src: He’s trying to think about Eva’s husband and is getting close to picturing him when Eva starts talking.
mt: 他絞盡腦汁幻想著伊娃的丈夫，剛有眉目時，伊娃開始和他說話。

src: There are bits and pieces of his past floating to the surface. He remembers his dad drowning in the pool, he remembers meeting Sandra at university, he remembers taking his family to cities so big they made Christchurch look like a drop in a bucket.
mt: 回憶的片段不斷湧入腦海：他記得父親在游泳池溺水身亡，記得在大學與桑德拉相遇，記得帶著家人到過許多大城市，相比之下，克萊斯特徹奇這方寸之地簡直微不足道。

src: You had no answer, and didn’t offer one.
mt: 你也不知道，所以沒有回答。
llm_reason: Preserves core meaning with natural literary flow.

src: “But you can remember being on tour years ago?”
mt: 「你能記得多年以前的旅行嗎？」

src: Chris leans over and tries to get Jerry to let go, then Mayor lashes out with a fist and gets Jerry in the side of the face.
mt: 克里斯靠了過來，想讓傑瑞放手，梅厄一拳頭使勁砸在傑瑞的臉上。

src: You poisoned all of that by taking away her future.
mt: 你剝奪了她的未來，毀掉了所有。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: “What is it you’re reading there?” Hans asks.
mt: 「你在看什麼？」漢斯問。

src: Henry Cutter was only a name and, like earlier today, he needs Henry’s help.
mt: 亨利·卡特只是一個名字。但像今天早些時候一樣，他還需要亨利的幫助。

src: It’s his desk, and his couch, and his framed prints on the wall. It’s his office chair, his bookcase, his potted plant on the table, his stereo, his phone, his lamp. The house came with more than just pieces of furniture.
mt: 他的辦公桌，他的沙發，他牆上掛著的裱框畫，他的辦公椅，他的書櫃，他的盆花，他的音響，他的電話，他的檯燈，房間里還有幾件傢具。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: You ever killed anybody, Jerry?
mt: 你殺過人，傑瑞。

src: “Tell me about her.”
mt: 「跟我說說她。」

src: You were excited, of course you were, but you felt a sense of loss, one that’s hard to explain, a sense Eva was moving on with her life and out of yours, and there’s a sense of loss because there will be grandchildren you may not get to meet, or if you do, you may end up forgetting them.
mt: 當然，你很興奮，又夾雜著一絲失落——很難解釋，感覺伊娃要離開你開始她自己的生活，你可能會有一個外孫，但你見不到了；或者即便你見到了，你也會最終忘記他們。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary translation.

src: you didn’t know what you were doing,” he says.
mt: 你……你不知道自己做了什麼。

src: The other development is the drinking really has become your best friend, though Sandra would tell you he’s the friend that doesn’t leave when the night is over.
mt: 另一個就是酒的確成了你最好的朋友，就像桑德拉說的，這樣的朋友哪怕黑夜散盡也不會離開。

src: “It’s not that. I just knew how things looked. That’s why I took the knife to the mall with me.”
mt: 「不是那樣的，我只知道事情的經過，這就是我為什麼把刀拿到商場的原因。」

src: The Jerry you used to be, the Jerry I used to be, he’s gone.
mt: 你曾經是傑瑞，我也曾經是傑瑞，後來他死了。

src: “Work?”
mt: 「什麼活兒？」

src: “Let’s say you’ve got a character who says he can’t remember killing somebody. How does that go?”
mt: 梅厄說，「比方說，你塑造了一個人物，他說他不記得殺過人了，請問這該怎麼辦呢？」

src: That was the life of a writer— keep writing, keep moving forward, stay ahead of the crowd because if you don’t get that story written down then somebody else would.
mt: 這就是一個作家的生活——不斷寫作，不斷前進，把他人甩在身後。如果你止步不前，寫不出精彩的故事，那麼別人就會超越你。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural literary flow.

src: They sit down at the table. All very social, Jerry thinks.
mt: 他們坐在桌邊，氛圍不錯，傑瑞心想。

src: “But she seems . . seems so real.”
mt: 「但她似乎……似乎是那麼真實。」

src: Jerry thinks about Sandra, he remembers the florist, and Suzan with a z, whose real name is lost to him now.
mt: 傑瑞想到了桑德拉，想起花店老闆，想起蘇姍，他現在已經記不起她的真實姓名了。

src: Jerry plays with the radio until he finds a news channel.
mt: 傑瑞擺弄著收音機，調到了一個新聞頻道。

src: Write what you know, and fake the rest.
mt: 「寫你所熟悉的，其餘的可以虛構。」

src: Then he leans back in. “I mean it, Jerry. I’m only going to be gone a minute, but don’t wander off, okay?”
mt: 過後他又回來：「我是認真的，傑瑞，我只離開一分鐘，不要出去遊盪了，好嗎？」

src: Terrance hands it to Nurse Hamilton, who shakes it out.
mt: 特倫斯把它遞給漢密爾頓護士，她把它抖開。

src: The shirt is balled up, but Jerry can see a collar and a cuff and what looks like rust.
mt: 襯衫被揉成一團，但傑瑞可以看到領子和袖口銹跡斑斑。

src: And yes, that’s a joke.
mt: 是的，這是一個笑話，一個盛滿了怒火的笑話。
llm_reason: Appropriate literary enhancement of the original meaning.

src: “If you forget, you forget.
mt: 「如果你忘記了，就忘記了。

src: “The author who wrote under the pseudonym Henry Cutter . . .”
mt: 「那個用筆名亨利·卡特寫作的作者……」

src: Hans laughs again. “You guys have more of an imagination than Jerry, and if he was here, and you believed it, then it wouldn’t be you here, but an armed unit busting down my door.”
mt: 漢斯又笑了笑，說：「你們這些人的想象力要比傑瑞豐富得多，如果他在這裏，那麼在這裏的就不該是你們，而是武裝罪犯調查組的人，他們會踏破我家的門。」

src: “No, not Mom’s,” Eva says.
mt: 「不，不是媽媽的。

src: Sometimes I say things I shouldn’t.”
mt: 我有時也會口不擇言的。」

src: I hear ya, mate. If things get to the point where you have to go into a care facility, and I’m sure they won’t, but if they do I’ll make sure there are some nurses in there who look like her.
mt: 「我聽說了，夥伴，等時機到了，你不得不住進療養院，我不敢肯定他們是否會送你進去，但我敢肯定會有和她相貌相仿的護士照顧你。」

src: Actually, enough joking around. How are you? Seriously, Jerry, you doing okay?
mt: 開玩笑的，傑瑞，說正經的，你還好嗎？

src: He’s a little like Rain Man when it comes to numbers too. He can’t look at a spilled jar of toothpicks on the floor and tell you how many there are, but he can perform all sorts of complex arithmetic in his head.
mt: 涉及數字時，他有點兒像《雨人》里的雷蒙，雖說他不能僅憑掃一眼打翻在地上的牙籤就告訴你有多少根，但是他可以在心裏完成各種各樣複雜運算。

src: “The shirt found yesterday, it was—”
mt: 「昨天發現了一件襯衫，這是——」

src: Jerry can’t help but be impressed. Henry Cutter has performed his most famous trick: he’s driven the story into the unknown.
mt: 傑瑞印象很深刻，亨利·卡特又在玩弄他最拿手的把戲了：他將故事帶進未知的境地。

src: “You have to—”
llm_reason: Accurate and natural translation of incomplete sentence.

src: She gave you a sad smile that told you there’s a lot of heartache and heartbreak on the way.
mt: 她對你憂傷地一笑，你知道她這笑容里包含了多少痛楚和心碎。

src: He puts his hands over his face and cries into them. The world goes dark.
mt: 他雙手捂住了臉，整個世界驟然漆黑一片，他嗚嗚地哭了起來。

src: And for you, Jerry, things just got a whole lot worse.
mt: 至於你呢，傑瑞，你只會變得更糟。

src: “You shoot me now,” Jerry says, “and it only makes things worse for you.”
mt: 「你現在要是開槍，」傑瑞說，「只會讓事情變得更糟。」

src: “But we don’t know that,” Jerry says, “not for a fact, and even if that is true who the hell is going to believe us, huh?”
mt: 傑瑞說：「但是我們並不知道，即便是真的，誰他媽會相信我們？」

src: Actually, you know what? There’s a character in one of the books—he bought a gun and hid it beneath a loose floorboard in his office.
mt: 你知道嗎，其實是書中的角色買了一把槍，把它藏在辦公室里一塊鬆動的地板下。

src: Jerry walks over to the bookshelf. All the books he owned, at least they’re gone, replaced by books that Terry has bought, including a whole shelf of Henry Cutter bestsellers, some titles he recognizes, some he doesn’t.
mt: 傑瑞走到書架前站定，他的書都不見了，書架上都是特里買的，包括亨利·卡特的暢銷書，有些書名他很熟悉，有些則聞所未聞。

src: “Look, I’m sorry I said that.
mt: 「聽著，實在抱歉，我說了那些話。

src: They spoke in front of the two detectives, Detective Mayor and Detective Something Else, and then she told them not to engage Jerry in conversation until his lawyer arrived.
mt: 他們倆是當著兩個警察的面說這些話的，警察梅厄和某某，她告訴他們不要急著跟傑瑞談話，要等他的律師來。

src: It was going to be in a year or so, but now it’s going to be in a few months.
mt: 本來這場轉變需要一年左右的時間，但現在只剩個把月了。

src: So somebody pretty clever got away with it, don’t you think?”
mt: 一個非常狡猾的殺人犯殺人之後逃之夭夭，你覺得是這樣嗎？」

src: Are your prints on the bag?”
mt: 你在塑料袋上留下指紋了嗎？」

src: The Bag Man stabbed his victims and when they were dead he tied a plastic garbage bag over their head. He was impersonalizing them.
mt: 「黑袋狂魔」行兇之後會在屍體的頭上套上一個塑料垃圾袋，把他們弄得不像個人。

src: She said Sandra had left him.
mt: 她說桑德拉只是離開了他。
llm_reason: Adds nuance without altering core meaning.

src: Hans shakes his head. “Listen to me, trust me, this is all some plot out of one of your—”
mt: 漢斯搖搖頭：「聽我說，相信我，這些都是你書中的情節——」

src: You and Henry are writing your next big seller.”
mt: 你和亨利正在寫下一本暢銷書。」

src: By the time she catches him he has already reached the front door of the house and knocked.
mt: 等她趕上他時，他已經到了門口開始敲門。

src: I think I prefer the bad days. When everybody is a stranger, when I forget my family, then I forget what brought me in here. I can forget what I have done.
mt: 我想我更喜歡糟糕的一天，那天，每個人都是陌生人，我忘了自己的家人，我忘記了我怎麼會在這裏，我可以忘記我做過的事情。

src: There is, he believes, a reason he has Alzheimer’s, and understanding that reason is the first step on the path to being cured.
mt: 他堅信自己患上阿爾茨海默病一定是因為作惡招致的天譴，弄清楚這個原因是治愈疾病的第一步。
llm_reason: Faithful to original meaning with literary adaptation.

src: “Moved on?
mt: 「走了？
llm_reason: Natural literary translation of casual inquiry.

src: That’s right, alarms are being put on the windows.
mt: 非常正確，窗戶上將會安裝警報器。

src: He shakes his head, looking distressed at the direction of the conversation. “You were right in the prime of your career.
mt: 他搖搖頭，對談話的內容深表悲痛，「您正處在寫作的巔峰時期。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary translation.

src: He says I should think of it as therapy.
mt: 他說我應該把它當作一種治療手段，這可能幫助我找回曾經的自己。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with appropriate literary expansion.

src: He looks down at the photographs, three of them representing women he has killed.
mt: 他看著那些照片，其中三張是他殺死的女人。

src: “But I’m such a big fan of the books,” Terrance adds, carrying on, “and you must have had so many good ideas in here and . . .
mt: 「但我是這些書的忠實書迷。」特倫斯補充說，「您在這兒一定萌生過很多絕妙的寫作想法……

src: “Why did you rip them out?”
mt: 「你為什麼要把那幾頁撕掉？」

src: Maybe Sandra will be home from work. She’s going to give him a hard time, but if he’s lucky by the end of the day he will have forgotten.
mt: 也許桑德拉馬上要下班回家了，她會讓他難堪的，不過要是幸運的話他會忘記的。

src: They get Eric to his feet. The orderly tries to struggle, but the duct tape is keeping the fight to a minimum.
mt: 他們讓艾瑞克站了起來，艾瑞克想掙扎，但綁著的膠帶只能將他的掙扎限制在最小幅度之內。

src: The person you need to apologize to the most is Belinda Murray.
mt: 而你最對不起的那個人是貝琳達·穆雷。

src: Speaking of kidding, you do have a pool, but you sure don’t remember walking down to it, because it’s winter, but hey, there you go.
mt: 說到開玩笑，你家的確有個游泳池，但因為是冬天，你肯定不記得去那兒游過泳。不過，事情就是這樣。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with appropriate tone.

src: He glances at the screwdriver in Jerry’s hand. He’s just met his idol and his idol is a psychopath who’s now armed.
mt: 他看了看傑瑞手中的螺絲刀，他剛剛遇到自己的文學偶像，但他的偶像是精神病患者，手裡還拿著武器。

src: You thought it was a restaurant you were meeting Eva and Rick at, but it was a bakery, and the owner was a friend of Rick’s aunty, or the uncle of a cousin, or somebody he was abandoned with on an island for a year, and they stayed open late so you could all meet there and gorge on two dozen different types of desserts, which got narrowed down to three for the wedding.
mt: 你認為和伊娃以及瑞克碰頭的地方是間餐廳，但它是一個麵包店，店主是瑞克姑媽的一個朋友，或者是表弟的叔叔，或者是跟他一起被遺棄在島上一年多的什麼人。他們的店會開到很晚，所以你們可以在這裏品嘗到二十多種不同的甜點，再為婚禮挑出三種。
llm_reason: Accurate and natural literary translation with proper nuance.

src: Because by then I’ll have forgotten?”
mt: 因為到時我就忘記了嗎？」

src: It’s a false wall, no taller than his forearm but the width of the wardrobe.
mt: 這是面假牆，比他的前臂略低，和衣櫃同寬。

src: You asked me again about the blood on the shirt. You told me Sandra had spoken to the nurse. You and Sandra were confused because the events didn’t line up.
mt: 你再次向我打探襯衫上的血，你告訴我桑德拉和護士交談過了，你和桑德拉很不解，因為事情說不通。
llm_reason: Core meaning preserved with natural flow.

src: “Why couldn’t it be Doctor Goodnews?”
mt: 「為什麼不是古德紐斯醫生？」

src: You, Future Jerry, you got to be the very thing you’d always dreamed of becoming—a writer.
mt: 未來的傑瑞，你曾實現過夢寐以求的理想，成了一個作家。

src: You don’t know —of course you don’t—but then she says one of the neighbors said they saw you doing it—or at least somebody who looked like you.
mt: 你當然一無所知，但她說一個鄰居說他目睹是你做的，或者至少是個看起來像你的人做的。

src: Yes—there was the car keys getting lost, but they would get found too, wouldn’t they?
mt: 是的，有人丟了車鑰匙，但他們會找到的，不是嗎？

src: “Did we get it? The Madness Journal?”
mt: 「我們拿到了嗎，『狂人日記』？」

src: The woman at passport control didn’t find it funny and you were detained, but only for fifteen minutes during which you were given a stern telling off and a reminder that immigration was not a joke.
mt: 入境檢驗處的女工作人員認為這沒什麼好笑的，你就被扣留了，但只有十五分鐘，在這期間他們給予你嚴厲的警告。

src: Jerry nods. “Sometimes people say my books are implausible. I remember that.”
mt: 傑瑞點點頭說：「有時候人們說我的書太虛假了，我記得的。」

src: You ended up introducing a new character, which has really helped—a guy by the name of Nicholas, and Nicholas brings a whole new element to the story, some heart and depth that was lacking before.
mt: 你在修訂時添加了一個新角色，這個叫尼古拉斯的人為故事帶來新的元素，彌補了作品在情感和深度上的不足。

src: the crime writer label seems to fit, like putting on a comfortable glove, and he knows what she’s saying is true. Of course it’s true.
mt: 不過……「犯罪小說家」這個名頭似乎完全符合他的身份，就像戴上一副舒適的手套，他知道她所說的是真的。

src: At least you can’t leave the house without the alarms going off, right?
mt: 「至少你離開房屋時，不可能不觸發警報器，對不對？」

src: “Just that there’s somewhere else. I think it’s where I used to hide my writing backups.”
mt: 「只是還有別的地方，我認為是我以前藏手稿備份的地方。」

src: Still stalling.
mt: 還是拖延。

src: He doesn’t recognize any of the furniture, and there’s a large painting on the lounge wall of horses running along a beach that he doesn’t remember ever seeing.
mt: 所有傢具他都不認識了，客廳牆上掛著一幅巨大的油畫，畫著海灘美景，駿馬奔騰，他也不曾見過。

src: It will break your fucking heart.
mt: 這真他媽的讓你心碎不已啊。

src: “Then we need to go in and get it,” Hans says.
mt: 「那我們需要進去，找到它。」漢斯說。

src: You balled the shirt up and put it back, and then she explained everything.
mt: 你把襯衫揉成團，又放了回去，她向你解釋了所有的事情。

src: “It was . . . I . . . I can’t remember.”
mt: 「是……我……我不記得了。」

src: She looked up at me and I could tell she had figured it out.
mt: 她抬頭看著我，我明白她全知道了。

src: Hans boosts himself up and confirms it’s the right house while Jerry continues to look at the house they’ve just snuck past.
mt: 漢斯踮起腳跟向里張望，確認這就是他們要找的房子了，而傑瑞繼續看著他們剛剛經過的房子。

src: There was already music playing in the church, but now it changed to a different piece that was your cue to start moving.
mt: 教堂里已經奏響音樂，但現在換了一首不同的曲目，這在暗示你行動開始了。

src: Sandra and Eva are still running around like the sky is falling.
mt: 桑德拉和伊娃依舊在四處奔波，就像天要塌下來似的。

src: He keeps his head twisted so he can keep his eye on Jerry the whole time.
mt: 他把頭歪向這邊，好一直看著傑瑞。

src: But she was still sweating, even more so, and panting.
mt: 她氣喘吁吁，仍在出汗，汗冒得越來越多。

src: When he first told me, I thought it was the setup to some awful joke.
mt: 當他第一次告訴我時，我認為這是一個恐怖的玩笑。

src: “I know,” Jerry says, scratching at his arm harder now.
mt: 「我知道。」傑瑞說，他在手臂上抓撓得更凶了。

src: He grabs some ice from the freezer. There’s no tonic anywhere, so he ends up making a couple of vodka and orange drinks.

mt: 寫作房門上的把手轉動起來，門開了，是她——史密斯太太，她站在門口揮舞著曲棍球棒。

src: That’s right—when you got outside you put a cigarette into your mouth and before you even lit it you knew you don’t smoke.
mt: 對的，你走出商店，取出一支香煙放進嘴裏。當你剛要把它點燃時，你忽然意識到你從來不抽煙的。

src: Jerry laughs.
mt: 傑瑞哈哈大笑起來，卻又戛然而止。

src: You convinced her not to go to the police because, after all, what had you done?
mt: 你說服她不要去報警，你做過什麼呢？

src: “We’re just chitchatting here,” Mayor says.
mt: 「我們只是在閑聊罷了。」

src: You are in limbo now, just spending the hours imagining your life without Sandra.
mt: 你現在心神不定，不知所措，只花幾個小時想象沒有桑德拉的生活該怎麼過。

src: The pages have always remained blank, because your ideas tend to get scribbled down on Post-it notes and stuck around the sides of the computer monitor, but the notebook (now to be a journal) has always remained in the top drawer of your desk, and every now and then you’ll take it out and run your thumb over the cover and remember when she gave it to you.
mt: 但你從未在筆記本里寫下一個字，因為你總是把自己的想法潦草地記在便條紙上，在電腦顯示器上粘了一圈。筆記本（現在是日記本）一直放在辦公桌最上面的抽屜里，你會不時地把它拿出來，用拇指在封面上摩挲著，反覆回想她是何時給你的。

src: This knife with a blade no longer than six inches, its dark wooden handle, its serrated edge, this little knife that was the biggest knife in the world.
mt: 這把刀長不足六英寸，深色刀柄，邊緣有鋸齒，這把小刀將是世界上最大的刀。

src: The girl is naked. Her hair is blond and her skin is pale and her eyes are blue, so open and so blue.
mt: 女孩全身赤|裸，一頭金髮，皮膚雪白，雙眼睜得那麼大，眼眸是那麼湛藍。

src: Perhaps Henry grew enough to occasionally take control.
mt: 也許是亨利成熟了，所以偶爾還能控制。

src: Before he can get a second shot in, Hans gets his arm inside of Jerry’s and hits him in the throat, not hard, but hard enough to struggle for his next breath and to start coughing.
mt: 還沒等他第二次出手，漢斯已經揮起手臂，一拳擊中了他的喉嚨，不夠狠，但足以讓他難受半天才喘過氣來。傑瑞咳嗽起來。

src: You sat out on the deck.
mt: 你們坐在露台上。

src: “All?”
mt: 「所有人？」

src: His lawyer stays where he is, probably figuring he can’t charge any more than he already is so there’s no point in patting Jerry on the back and telling him everything is going to be okay. No point in risking getting anything gooey on his suit.
mt: 他的律師仍舊一動不動，大概是盤算著他反正又不能收取額外費用了，所以還是別冒著弄髒西裝的風險去拍拍傑瑞的背然後告訴他一切都會好的。

src: On the back of the door somebody has written at the top Damien is awesome, and below that people have written other things, reminding Jerry of the comment sections online, a long list starting with That’s because Damien has a vagina and ending with Fuck the world.
mt: 門的背面有人在上面寫道：「達米安真棒。」底下有人跟著寫了長長一列文字，這讓傑瑞想到網上的評論。底下第一行寫著：「因為達米安有陰|道。」結尾寫著：「操蛋的世界。」

src: “What happens in your books, Jerry, when people are hoping for the best?”
mt: 「傑瑞，如果人們都渴望幸福的結局的話，在你的書里會有什麼樣的後果？」

src: “They can always find blood on those things,” Hans says.
mt: 「他們總能在那些東西上面發現血漬的。」

src: She turned towards him, but it wasn’t the Jerry from the bedroom, it was the Jerry she fell in love with, the one she met in university, the one who was in the Star Trek closet, the one whose side she would never leave.
mt: 他已經不是卧室里的傑瑞了，他是她深愛的傑瑞，是她在大學相識的傑瑞，是藏滿了一柜子《星際迷航》影碟的傑瑞，是她永遠不離不棄的傑瑞。

src: “The others you’ve killed.”
mt: 「被你殺死的人。」

src: Then Jerry was going to shoot himself too.
mt: 然後，傑瑞會飲彈自盡。

src: The wedding is now less than three weeks away. You’re too scared to look at your credit card bill—which, by the way, you don’t get to see anymore.
mt: 距離婚禮還有不到三個星期，你不敢看你的信用卡賬單了。

src: Hans has been a pretty big help to you over the years. He’s what you would call . . . source material.
mt: 多年以來，漢斯一直在給予你幫助，他就是你所說的「寫作材料源」。

src: Just because you hid a can of spray-paint in your office doesn’t mean you used a can of spray-paint on your neighbor’s house.
mt: 僅僅就因為你在寫作房裡藏了個噴漆罐並不意味著你在鄰居家的房子上噴過漆。

src: You knew it then, just as you’d suspected it the night before—you knew if you had hurt somebody, you would pay the ultimate price.
mt: 你心裏很清楚，即便前天夜裡你還十分懷疑，那就是如果你傷害了別人，你會為此付出最大的代價。

src: He finds a table and waits for one of the waitresses to come over—they normally do with coffee, and to check your room number—but nobody shows up, which is okay, because he can’t actually think what his room number is, and, come to think of it, he must have locked his key card in the room.
mt: 他看見一張空桌，就坐了下來，等著服務員，他們通常會主動端來一杯咖啡，檢查一下房間號。但沒有人來，沒關係，剛好他也不記得房間號，趁著這個機會回想回想，他一定是把門卡鎖在房間里了。

src: Of course there were no notes—but you did call your editor this morning and she made the mistake of saying Nice to hear from you, Jerry. I trust you are well?
mt: 當然了，並沒有什麼約稿函，倒是你今天早上給編輯打過電話，她說話時出現了口誤，她說：「很高興你打電話過來，傑瑞，我覺得你還不錯吧？」

src: Not day one where things started to change—that started a year or two back—but day one of the diagnosis.
mt: 這並非癥狀開始發生髮作的第一天——這個癥狀從一兩年前就開始了——這是確診的第一天。

src: The ringing stops. There is silence for ten seconds. Then there is tapping at the office window.
mt: 鈴聲停止了，有十秒鐘的沉默，接著傳來拍打寫作房窗戶的聲音。

src: “Under the floor maybe?”
mt: 「在地板下面？」

src: “So you won’t mind if we come in and take a look around?”
mt: 「那麼，我們要是進來到處看看你不會介意吧？」

src: “They had to sedate me because the shirt made them think the worst, and they wouldn’t believe me about the journal, and the journal is the key to all of this.
mt: 「他們必須讓我保持鎮靜，因為我的襯衫讓他們想到了最糟糕的情景，他們不會相信我說的那些日記，而日記卻是解決所有事情的關鍵。

src: I know what you’re saying makes sense, that there’s a certain kind of logic to it, but it just feels too convenient that I can remember some things but not others.
mt: 我知道你說得在理，也符合邏輯，只是我覺得我可以太容易想起某些事，有些卻不能。

src: There’s nothing to remember, he said, or words to that effect.
mt: 「什麼也不用記得。」他如是說，或大致是這個意思。

src: But you don’t remember spraypainting the bad word across Mrs. Smith’s house, and you obviously did that, so there’s no denying the fact you do things and then forget.
mt: 你不記得用油漆在史密斯太太的房子上噴上污言穢語，但很明顯你這樣做了。所以，是你做了那些事情，只是忘記了，這是無可否認的事實。

src: It’s a fair point, he thinks, then tells Hans as such.
mt: 這樣說是公平的，他這麼認為，然後他告訴了漢斯。

src: It doesn’t seem like the kind of thing anybody, let alone Hans, would overlook.
mt: 任何人都不可能視而不見，更不用說漢斯了。

src: You have two hours to figure out where this journal of yours is.”
mt: 你有兩個小時來想出日記在哪裡。」

src: He comes over and looks at the one Jerry’s signing and his smile disappears a little.
mt: 他走了過來，看著傑瑞的一個簽名，笑容忽然消失了。

src: Jerry reaches into his pocket. He shows Hans the key. “We won’t need them.”
mt: 傑瑞把手伸進口袋，拿出鑰匙給漢斯看：「我們不需撬鎖工具。」

src: Of course that’s the old horror writer in you thinking that.
mt: 當然，這隻是你這個老恐怖小說家心裏的念頭。

src: No. It wasn’t me, but that’s not who I’m talking about.
mt: 不，不是我，我說的也不是她。

src: But he can’t remember walking into town, can’t remember these women, can’t remember any of it.
mt: 但是，他不記得步行進城，不記得這些女人，任何事情都不記得。

src: He checks on Sandra. She’s fine.
mt: 他看了看桑德拉，她還在熟睡。

src: “Get off me, you crazy prick,” Mayor screams, and buries the fingers of his good hand into Jerry’s forearms, but Jerry keeps a tight hold, all while Chris swerves the car to the side of the road and brings it to a stop.
mt: 「放開我，你這個瘋子！」梅厄尖叫道，用另一隻手掐住傑瑞的手臂，但傑瑞抓得更緊了。克里斯把車子轉了個彎，停到路邊。

src: He said you probably just found the knife somewhere. It was actually a really simple explanation.
mt: 他說你可能是在別的地方發現刀的，這其實是個非常簡單的辯解。

src: “If I were to sneak in there later tonight to look for it, where would I start?”
mt: 「如果我今天晚上悄悄進到房子去找，我應該從哪裡下手？」

src: “Nothing else,” he says. “Are you sure it’s here?”
mt: 「沒有別的了，」他說，「你確定是在這裏嗎？」

src: “Forgetting about the fact that I dropped you off at home that night, and I saw you wearing that bloody shirt, how does he do it?”
mt: 「難道你忘了那天晚上我送你回家，我看到你穿著那件該死的血襯衫，他是怎麼做到的？」

src: You’ll be in jail before you even know what hit you.
mt: 你還不知道是怎麼回事，就會被關進監獄的。」

src: Soon she will try and talk you into a care facility. Then she can pick out a new table without you.
mt: 不久她就會想方設法誆你搬進療養院，接著她就可以趁著你不在時買張新桌子。

src: After everything Hans has done for him?
mt: 尤其是在看到漢斯為他所做的一切之後。

src: This is Version II—Version I was written as Jerry’s Normal Life phase entered the Madness phase.
mt: 這是版本二的日記，版本一是在傑瑞從正常步入瘋狂時寫就的。

src: It’s like he was telling himself (or Henry was telling him) back in the house: he has to think of this like one of his books.
mt: 就像他在家裡自言自語（或者是亨利告訴他的）一樣，他得把現在的場景視作在他的書里發生的一樣。

src: But seriously, folks, as any parent will do when they’re seeing their child getting married, you think back to when it was your own time, you think back and you wonder how the years have gone by so quickly, there are always ups and downs in a relationship, and the older you are the more you’ve been through, and the more you’ve been through the more advice you can give.
mt: 「但說真的，朋友們，為人父母在看到自己的孩子結婚時都會這麼做，你會想起這個孩子只屬於你的時候。你會納悶，時間怎麼過得這麼快？一生中，總會有些潮起潮落，你年紀越大，經歷的事情越多，給孩子們的忠告就越多。

src: You got hungry this afternoon and heated up a tin of spaghetti.
mt: 今天下午，你有點兒餓，便熱了一罐意大利麵。

src: Of course people never know what they’re going to say when their time is up.
mt: 當然，臨終之前，人們永遠不知道該說什麼。

src: That must be where I was trying to go.
mt: 那兒一定是我想要去的地方。

src: Jerry Grey looking very pale and tired. Jerry Grey with crows-feet around his eyes and mouth.
mt: 傑瑞·格雷看起來面色蒼白，疲倦不堪，他眼角布滿魚尾紋，嘴角滿是法令紋。

src: You are trying to keep the suicide notes short.
mt: 你想把遺書寫得簡明扼要。

src: The garage door closes behind them. They both stay sitting in the car in the dark.
mt: 車庫門在他們身後關閉了，他們兩人都在黑暗之中。

src: People don’t just wake up one day wanting to kill people.
mt: 人們醒來后，並不是總想著去殺人。

src: Hans opens the car and starts going through it.
mt: 漢斯打開車門搜查。

src: In a way it’s a good thing too, because you know Sandra has been looking for it.
mt: 某種意義上說，這是一件好事，因為你知道桑德拉一直在找它。

src: Ah hell, you’ve probably forgotten all about the plate.
mt: 媽的，你可能真的忘了怎麼用盤子。

src: Only if any of that happened, you don’t know.
mt: 即使這些都發生了，你也不知道。

src: “It could have been anybody,” Jerry says.
mt: 「任何人都有可能。」傑瑞說，「那你有什麼建議嗎？」

src: He tries to draw in a deep breath, but it catches in his throat, and then it’s like swallowing a golf ball.
mt: 他想深呼吸，但氣息彷彿卡在喉嚨里，吞下去像吞一個高爾夫球。

src: Hans doesn’t look just concerned but worried too. He starts drumming his fingers faster.
mt: 漢斯的神情看起來不僅是關切，還摻雜著擔憂，他的手指敲擊得更迅速了。

src: “Go and find a security guard, or the mall management office and tell them who you are. You can wait there while—”
mt: 「去找保安，或者去商場諮詢台，告訴他們你是誰，你可以在那裡等著我

src: It’s something he used to get a lot.
mt: 這種事他遇到的多了。

src: Best to get out of here as soon as they can, but one thing he’s never done is say no to a fan wanting their books signed, and he’s not going to start saying no now.
mt: 他們最好儘快離開這裏，但他從來沒有拒絕過書迷簽名的請求，這一次同樣也不會。

src: Where else could you have hidden it?”
mt: 你還有可能把它藏在哪裡？」

src: When he’s gone Jerry heads out into the sun with A Christmas Murder.
mt: 醫生離開后，傑瑞拿著《聖誕節謀殺案》出來曬太陽。

src: You must have shot her because there’s a hole in her chest and her body is cool and it must have been a while ago and— You don’t know.
mt: 發生了什麼？一定是你開槍打死了她，因為她的胸部有一個彈孔，她的屍體冰涼，一定有一段時間了，而且——你不知道。

src: It’s not rocket science—use a can opener, pour the contents into a bowl, nuke the bowl in the microwave for two minutes.
mt: 這並不需要什麼精湛的廚藝，只要用開罐器開啟，把麵條倒入碗中，再把碗放進微波爐加熱兩分鐘即可。

src: You were the guy with Alzheimer’s, and to them that made you a joke.
mt: 你是阿爾茨海默病病人，對他們而言，這隻會讓你成為笑柄。

src: Terrance reaches back under the floor. He rotates his body a little as he reaches in every direction, patting the ground first, then patting the underside of the floorboards in case the journal is taped to the back of them.
mt: 特倫斯再次把手臂伸到地板下，他扭動著身體，四下摸索了一番，先是拍拍地面，然後又拍拍地板磚的底下，以免日誌被粘在背面。

src: “The problem is you used to sneak out the window.
mt: 「問題在於你還會常常翻窗外出。

src: If so, he doesn’t want Sandra or Eva there when they hang him. He would like Nurse Hamilton there. He can imagine her sad smile might make things feel a little less scary as the rope gets tightened.
mt: 如果是這樣，當他們絞死他時，他不希望桑德拉或伊娃在場；他希望漢密爾頓護士在場，當她向著他凄然微笑時，在繩索收緊的那一刻他也許會少些恐懼。

src: “The police probably didn’t know they were looking for it,” she says.
mt: 「警方可能根本不知道他們在找它。」

src: Past the couch and to the wardrobe.
mt: 走過沙發，走向衣櫃。

src: How many of the same qualities would you share with him?
mt: 你跟他有多少一樣的品質呢？

src: She pulled it out and held it away, the same way she does sometimes when she’s holding hair she just pulled out of the shower drain.
mt: 她把它抽出來，捏在手上，這跟她偶爾把從浴室排水溝里抽出的頭髮捏在手裡時的動作一樣。

src: At the moment you are hibernating in your office too scared to face her, and you’ve watched the footage from today over and over just like hundreds of other people have because Rick’s best man, let’s call him Prick, has posted it online.
mt: 此刻，你正在寫作房裡冬眠，你害怕面對她。你像其他幾百個人一樣，一遍又一遍地看今天的錄像，這都是因為瑞克的伴郎（讓我們叫他普瑞克）把它貼到了網上。

src: Mostly you revert back to a time over the last few years, though on occasion back to when you were much younger. There are days where you have absolutely no idea what is going on, where you can’t even feed yourself.
mt: 大多數情況下你會退回到幾年前的某段時光，偶爾也會回到更年輕時的時候，極少數情況下你會處在混沌無知的狀態，連吃飯都不會。

src: “I’ll make sure she knows you’re the reason I have to hurt her.
mt: 「我一定會讓她知道你是我傷害她的原因。

src: You went and closed the office window that was still open, the window you had climbed out of as Jerry Grey, but by the time you climbed back in you were somebody else.
mt: 你走過去，關上開著的窗戶，你曾以傑瑞·格雷的身份從窗口爬到屋外，但爬回來時不再是傑瑞·格雷了。

src: She reached out and Jerry fell into her embrace, and she started rubbing his back, and she knew he was feeling loved, but really all she was doing was wiping the cobwebs off her fingers from under the floorboards.
mt: 她站了起來，伸出雙臂擁抱傑瑞。她給他搓背，她知道他有一種被愛撫的感覺，但其實她只不過是想擦掉手指上的蜘蛛網。

src: Sometimes the imagination of a crime writer is a powerful thing. In fact he’d go as far as to say it’s a curse.
mt: 有時，犯罪小說家的想象力異常強大，簡直可以稱得上是一種詛咒了。

src: “We let him get a good look around, and then we drag him back in. I’ll slap him around a little, and we don’t ask questions, what we do is we give him statements.
mt: 「我們讓他好好看看周圍的環境，再把他拖回來，我會給他幾巴掌，我們不問他問題，只是給他暗示。

src: “I’m not so sure we have that much time,” Nurse Hamilton says, reminding Jerry that the police have been called.
mt: 「我不知道我們是否還有那麼多的時間。」漢密爾頓護士說，提醒傑瑞已經通知了警察。

src: He carries on with the journal.
mt: 他繼續往下閱讀日記。

src: I’m sorry, Jerry, I really am, and I don’t want this to sound awful, but we really need to focus on why we’re here.
mt: 真的很對不起，傑瑞，我不想把這件事講得如此痛心疾首。但我們現在就在這裏，我們必須先解決眼下的事。

src: Stop writing what you know.
mt: 不要再寫你熟悉的事情了。

src: “There are a million crime writers out there, buddy.
mt: 「犯罪小說家成千上萬啊，夥計。

src: For the last few hours you’ve let multiple memories flood your brain, enjoying the process, very well aware that soon they will be walled off by the changing landscape of neurological pathways.
mt: 在過去的幾個小時里，你的腦海里不斷湧現無數幀記憶畫面，你很享受，但你也十分清楚，不久它們將因神經通路的改變而被隔斷。

src: It could be the change of environment, it could be the fresh air he got between the nursing home and the car.
mt: 還有可能是因為環境發生了變化，走出療養院到上車之前，他呼吸到了清新的空氣。

src: “Either they’re not moving,” Hans says, “or they were never there to begin with.
mt: 「他們不會行動了。」漢斯說，「或者說，他們還沒有開始行動。

src: He can’t remember what he did yesterday, whether he watched TV or walked in the garden.
mt: 昨天做了什麼？是看電視還是在花園裡散步？他不記得最後一次看的什麼報紙，不記得最後一次擁抱妻子，不記得最後一次打的什麼電話或寫的什麼電子郵件。

src: The shirt?

src: You made a good point, partner.

They walk along the beach, they walk and talk, and Jerry looks out over the water, and he wonders how far his body could swim, how far he would make it before the dementia kicked in and he lost all rhythm.
