src: And if they find you, don’t you dare mention me, okay?”
mt: 如果他們發現你，可不要提我，好嗎？」

src: “The suit you’re wearing, the house you live in, the food you give your children, all of that is bought and paid for on the back of other people’s suffering.”
mt: 傑瑞說，「你穿的衣服、住的房子、給孩子吃的飯、買的一切，這些都建立在他人的痛苦之上。」

src: “She’s dead, Jerry,” Mayor says.
mt: 「她死了，傑瑞。」

src: This time Hans reaches across and punches him in the arm. “I said shut up. I wish to God I had turned you in that night.”
mt: 這次換漢斯伸手對他的手臂猛擊一拳：「我說閉嘴，我真希望那天晚上我把你扭送到了警察局。」

src: Hans shakes his head. “I know who the Bag Man is, Jerry, and you’re not him.”
mt: 漢斯搖搖頭：「我知道誰是『黑袋狂魔』，傑瑞，你不是的。」

src: You’ll know that if you remember him.
mt: 你若還記得他就知道這是什麼意思了。

src: Spending all night watching over Sandra, you thought mostly of how your actions had tainted all the good times you’d had. Your amazing life together, the passion with which you loved her.
mt: 整整一晚上，你守候著桑德拉，滿腦子想著你如何玷污了你們所有的美好時光，你們一生中所有精彩的時刻，你深愛著她的那份感情。

src: They drive to the hospital without any more barbecue conversation.
mt: 他們開車去醫院，一路上再沒有燒烤式的閑談了。

src: She says you sometimes confess to killing your neighbor when you were at university.
mt: 你有時承認上大學時殺死了鄰居。

src: The speech (two million hits now) and then the knife, and you and Sandra fought about that knife.
mt: 那段視頻（現在點擊量已經達到兩百萬了），還有刀，你和桑德拉因那把刀發生過爭吵。

src: You were wearing it that night when I picked you up.”
mt: 那天晚上我去接你時，你就是穿著那件襯衫。」

src: “Calm down, Jerry,” he says, keeping his voice low.
mt: 「冷靜下來，傑瑞。」

src: The world without Sandra is a world he doesn’t want to be in.
mt: 他胸腔里陣陣發緊。他不想待在沒有桑德拉的世界，他不知道沒有了她他該怎麼活下去。

src: There’s no need to search the house, you said. I’m sure it’s just Eva.
mt: 「沒有必要搜查房子了，」你說，「我敢肯定是伊娃。」

src: And what if she did start that new life, and in five years’ time there was a cure and Jerry became Jerry again?
mt: 萬一她真開始了新的生活，但五年後傑瑞痊癒了，他重新回到自己的軀殼裡了，她又該怎麼辦？

src: I’m sorry about Sandra, but now we need to concentrate on you.
mt: 我對桑德拉的遭遇深表遺憾，但現在我們需要集中精力辦你的事。

src: These entries come off as very realistic because they come from a genuine source.
mt: 這些篇章非常真實，因為它們來源本就是真實的。

src: You don’t just talk to yourself, but you have conversations with Henry, your favorite writer in residence.
mt: 你不只是自己跟自己說話，還跟你最喜歡的作家亨利對話。

src: When I told him I was going to take him to you, he hit me when we were stuck at the next set of lights and jumped out of the car. He ran across the road and by the time I was able to turn the car around I couldn’t find him.”
mt: 我告訴他我要帶他去見你們，當我們停在一個紅綠燈前時，他打了我，跳下車，跑到馬路對面去了，我把車掉過頭后已經找不到他了。」

src: You don’t know what’s going on, but Sandra is dead and Sandra is dead and Sandra. Is. Dead.
mt: 你不知道發生了什麼，但桑德拉死了，桑德拉死了。

src: He would deny it. He would suggest she leave the neighborhood because somebody seemed to have it in for her.
mt: 他會否認的，會建議她離開這個社區，因為有人總跟她過不去。

src: You’re framing me for the bad things you’ve done too?
mt: 你想把你做的壞事嫁禍給我？

src: Hans came to look after you, and you sat out on the deck like always and you had a beer and since nobody else was around, he lit up a joint just like he used to.
mt: 漢斯過來看你，你們像往常一樣出去坐在露台上，你喝著啤酒，因為旁邊沒有其他人，他則像以往一樣點燃一支大麻。

src: “If you—”
mt: 「如果你——」

src: There is no mystery here—he killed his wife, he killed the woman he found on the lounge floor, and quite possibly the woman the police were asking him about.
mt: 沒有什麼疑問了，他殺害了自己的妻子，殺害了倒在客廳地板上的女孩，並且很可能還殺害了警察問起過的女人。

src: You hope her anger towards you doesn’t cloud the way she sees the world, that it doesn’t darken her music.
mt: 你希望她對你的憤怒不會影響她看待世界的方式，不會使她的音樂變得頹廢。

src: Jerry reaches into the bag for his water.
mt: 傑瑞把手伸進購物袋裡拿水。

src: Jerry can feel something rise up in his stomach.
mt: 傑瑞可以感覺到他胃裡在翻騰。

src: The Bag Man, in case you’ve forgotten, stabs women in the chest and then ties a black garbage bag over their heads.
mt: 怕你忘了，就提醒你一下，「黑袋狂魔」會拿刀刺向女人的胸口，然後在她們的頭上套上一個黑色垃圾袋。

src: “It was sold.”
mt: 「賣了。」

src: Jerry doesn’t know what to say, not at first, but then reverts to what he knows is the absolute truth.
mt: 傑瑞起初不知道該說什麼，但隨後斷定他所知道的絕對是真相。

src: You haven’t forgotten the wedding speech.
mt: 但你沒有忘記婚禮上的講話。

src: In which case you walked aimlessly all that way to the house of somebody you had never met,” he says.
mt: 在這種情況下，你只是漫無目的地走進了你從來沒有見過的人的家裡。」

src: If you did spraypaint her house, was it on the suggestion of somebody who doesn’t exist?
mt: 如果你的確在她家的房子上噴漆了，是不是因為你聽從了某個不存在的人的建議？

src: He has no idea how it feels, but at least he’s sympathetic to the cause.
mt: 他雖然不能感同身受，但至少也會同情一下。

src: It’s empty.
mt: 是空的。

src: They’re already tightening the noose, Jerry. But there’s another option,” Hans says. “An option I can give you because you’re my friend.”
mt: 他們已經收緊了絞索，傑瑞，但還有另一種選擇，我可以給你指條明路，因為你是我的朋友。」

src: The memories shift, they stir, some of them settle, some of them disappear.
mt: 記憶在遊動，在翻滾，有些沉澱了下來，有些消失無蹤。

src: He signs To Gary, best wishes in the rest of the books simply because he’s run out of other things to say.
mt: 在其他的書上，他只簽了「致加里，祝好」幾個字，因為他想不起別的話。

src: “What are you talking . . .” he says, then the images all come rushing, so many of them at one time it makes him dizzy, so many he can’t make any sense of them.
mt: 「你在說什麼……」他說，接著一幅幅畫面奔騰著浮現在眼前，讓他有些暈眩，但他對這些畫面沒有絲毫印象。

src: “I don’t,” he says, and then coughs a little bit more. “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
mt: 「我不……」他說，咳嗽了一聲，「我不知道你在說什麼。」

src: “Come on, let’s go before we miss the sunset.”
mt: 他說，「好了，我們走吧，不然日落之前就趕不到了。」

src: “I’ll go and find them, Jerry, I promise,” he says, and he stands up.
mt: 「我去幫你找，傑瑞，我答應你。」他說著站了起來，「等我走了你躺下來休息一會兒，好嗎？

src: He searches his memory, trying to form a connection.
mt: 他搜尋著記憶，想重新與過去建立聯繫。

src: At that point Hans could do anything he wanted, so what he did was sit down and think things through.
mt: 那一刻，漢斯可以為所欲為，所以他坐了下來，好把事件想清楚。

src: “The Ray Bradbury quote?”
mt: 雷·布拉德伯里的格言？」

src: Planning on sneaking back over the road to Mrs. Smith’s house?
mt: 打算溜回史密斯太太家裡去嗎？

src: They drive in silence, and the closer they get to his house the more things begin to become familiar.
mt: 他們默默地開著，車離他家越近，一切就越來越清晰。

src: It hurt. But you know the truth, you know why she’s really taking them. It’s to control you.
mt: 這話很傷人，但是你知道她拿走鑰匙的真實目的是要控制你。

src: “We can’t wait,” he tells her.
mt: 「我們不能等。」

src: Without any warning Jerry twists towards Hans and swings with his left arm. He punches his friend as hard as he can in the mouth, but the angles and the geometry of the enclosed car don’t give him as much leverage as he would like, making the punch less effective than he’d hoped. Hans’s head snaps to the side.
mt: 沒有發出任何警告，傑瑞扭身面對漢斯，揮起左臂，使出最大力氣用拳砸向他朋友的嘴部，但封閉車廂的角度和幾何形狀影響了他可以發揮的力道，這一拳打得不夠狠，漢斯的頭擺到一邊。

src: “Just after six.”
mt: 「剛過六點。」

src: She stormed out of the room. You didn’t call after her. You couldn’t.
mt: 她衝出房間，你沒有叫住她，你也做不到。

src: She sighed. She had gone through this already. “Belinda is the florist.”
mt: 她嘆了口氣，這種情況她已經麻木了：「貝琳達是花店老闆。」

src: “I washed it pretty good.”
mt: 「我沖洗得很乾凈。」

src: I’d always had this theory that if you did that, the person would wake up, and that’s what happened.
mt: 我一直信奉著一個理論，那就是如果你一旦動手了，這人就醒了。

src: “I must still have some money.
mt: 他說，「我肯定還有一筆錢。

src: “This is it,” Hans whispers, then drops to the other side.
mt: 「就是這兒。」漢斯低聲道，縱身跳到另一側。

src: “Did I go to jail?
mt: 「我去坐牢了？

src: He’s been told he woke up this morning a little confused, but this afternoon he knows who he is—fifty-year-old Jerry Grey, killer of one, at least one.
mt: 他們說他今天早上醒來時有點兒困惑迷惘，但到了下午他就對自己知根知底了：他是五十多歲的傑瑞·格雷，犯過謀殺罪的兇手，至少殺害過一個人。

src: for some reason, for some stupid reason, I didn’t call them.
mt: 我……出於某種原因，出於某種愚蠢的原因，沒有打電話報警。

src: “So tell us, Jerry,” Mayor says.
mt: 「那你跟我們說說，傑瑞。」

src: She stressed that was the worst case, but the fact that at forty-nine you got Alzheimer’s, well, isn’t that already worst case?
mt: 她強調這是最壞的打算。但是，你四十九歲就患上阿爾茨海默病，這難道不是最壞的情況？

src: umm . . .
You said you weren’t being rude, that you’re not really a dessert guy, and you didn’t understand why they couldn’t have left you at home to work out your ideas for the new book.
mt: 你說你不是粗魯，你只是不喜歡甜點，你不懂他們為什麼不能把你留在家裡構思新作。

src: They close the door behind them and pause and listen, Jerry’s heart louder now, his breathing heavy. There is no beeping keypad. No alarm.
mt: 他們關上身後的門，停下來側耳傾聽，傑瑞的心跳聲更響了，他的呼吸很重，沒有警報器。

src: She said there would be good days and there would be bad. Take from that what you will, Future Jerry.
mt: 她說以後的日子有好有壞，未來的傑瑞，這就看你如何看待了。

src: Hans asks, carrying on. “He waits outside the nursing home every night in a van hoping you’re going to escape? Then, the times you do, he picks you up, kills somebody in front of you, you take a nap and wake up and forget where you are? Then conveniently forget everything leading up to it?”
mt: 漢斯問，他又接著說，「他每天晚上都開著一輛麵包車在療養院外等著，準備讓你出逃？然後你出逃的時候，他接應你，在你面前殺死一個人，你打個盹，醒來，忘了你在哪裡，忘了所有一切？」

src: “I’m just so . . .
mt: 「我真是……糟透了。」

src: Lots of gasping as people realize he’s not joking.
mt: 意識到他不是在開玩笑，許多人都倒吸了一口涼氣。

src: he asks. “Did you write this after I told you what happened?”
mt: 他問，「是我告訴了你一切，然後你寫了這本書嗎？」

src: The longer the wait, the more time Eva can have thinking the world is okay.
mt: 拖的時間越長，伊娃認為一切還好的時間就會越久。

src: “It should be here, but it’s not.
mt: 不應該是這樣呀！它應該在這裏的，但是卻不在！」

src: She has also taken away your credit card after the whole cat food thing.
mt: 在貓糧事件后，她又拿走了你的信用卡。

src: “And a year ago when you found me covered in blood?”
mt: 「當你一年前發現我滿身是血的時候？」

src: and hey, I know it’s stupid, and maybe weird, but sometimes stupid works out, right?”
mt: 我知道這有些蠢，也有點兒詭異，但有時傻人有傻福，對吧？」

src: “Sometimes I’m not so sure there is.
mt: 「我也不太確定有沒有。

src: “Well it has to be somewhere,” she said.
mt: 「肯定在什麼地方。」她說。

src: “I have to go now,” he says, and then he hangs up.
mt: 「我得掛了，」他說，然後他掛了電話。

src: She says you were so adamant about it that they looked through old news reports and they spoke to Eva about it, but it just didn’t happen.”
mt: 她說你實在是太固執了，他們翻看過以前的新聞報道，也和伊娃談論過，結果證明什麼都沒有發生過。」

src: Henry thinks he’s lying. Henry thinks there’s an ulterior motive for Eric wanting you to write in the journal, and Henry does, after all, deal in ulterior motives (most of the characters he creates have one).
mt: 亨利認為他在撒謊，他認為艾瑞克巴不得你寫日記是出於某種不可告人的動機，亨利恰恰善於識別某些心懷鬼胎的動機（他塑造的大多數人物形象都包藏禍心）。

src: “What do you mean gone?”
mt: 「什麼叫『不見了』？」

src: “Then try harder.”
mt: 「再加把勁。」

src: Jerry asks, pulling his hands back.
mt: 傑瑞抽回雙手問。

src: It was a label he couldn’t shake, and within forty-eight hours he was arrested and charged with her murder, and a year later he was found guilty and sentenced to fourteen years in jail.
mt: 這是他無法擺脫的嫌疑，他在四十八小時內被逮捕，被控謀殺罪，一年後，他被判定有罪，並判處十四年有期徒刑。

src: Dad, walk there. Jerry, hold Eva like this.
mt: 「爸爸，走到那裡。」「傑瑞，像這樣挽著伊娃。」

src: “I didn’t do it. That’s why they’re not finding any evidence of me at the scene.”
mt: 「我沒有做過，這就是為什麼他們在現場沒有發現任何證據。」

src: He came over and you introduced him to Hans, and Hans took his hand and applied a little too much pressure and said If you ever hurt her, if you ever cheat on her, Jerry here may not be around to protect his little girl, but I will be.
mt: 他走了過來，你把他介紹給漢斯，漢斯和他握手時故意用了點力，說：「如果你敢傷害她，如果你敢騙她，傑瑞可能不會過來保護他的女兒，但我會。

src: “You know about that?”
mt: 「你知道？」

src: You’re a cop, and you’re trying to trick me,” he says, doing his best not to sound angry.
mt: 你是警察，你騙我！」他說道，儘力壓制著語氣里的怒火。

src: It’s the quickest of glances, but Hans must notice it too.
mt: 只是快速的一瞥，但漢斯一定注意到了。

src: Not only have you accepted what’s happening, but you’re ready.
mt: 你不僅接受了所發生的事情，而且還嚴陣以待起來。

src: Jerry says he will do whatever it takes to make it happen.
mt: 傑瑞說，他將竭盡所能，無論付出什麼代價也要實現自己的夢想。

src: He shakes his head. “If the police couldn’t find it, the new owners wouldn’t have either.”
mt: 他搖搖頭：「如果連警方找不到，新業主也不會找到。」

src: Thank God, she said, and her clothes were pasted to her body, sweat was dripping down her face and her cheeks were flushed.
mt: 「感謝老天。」她上氣不接下氣地說。她臉頰通紅，大汗淋漓，衣服都貼在了身上。

src: Jerry Grey naked from the waist up but with smears of blood on his chest and arms and face.
mt: 傑瑞上身赤|裸著，胸前、手臂和臉上有成片的血跡。

src: A year ago if the table had been marked by accident, Sandra would have suggested getting a new one.
mt: 一年前，如果桌子不小心弄上了印跡，桑德拉會建議買張新的。

src: He should pick up the lawyer’s pen and, if the door is unlocked, run among the desks threatening to stab somebody until they put him down and end this nightmare.
mt: 如果門沒有鎖，他應該拿起律師的筆跑到外面，揚言威脅要刺死什麼人，這樣他們就能把他打倒在地，結束這場噩夢。

src: “What do you mean I visited her at home?”
mt: 「你的意思是我去她家裡看她了？」

src: Being in the church with your hand in Sandra’s, and your arm around Eva, watching them smile, watching them laugh, it gives you a sense of completion.
mt: 在教堂里，桑德拉握著你的手，伊娃挽著你的胳膊，你看著她們微笑，看著他們哈哈大笑，這足以讓你覺得完滿了。

src: You were out on the deck with Hans when the florist came over to see Eva.
mt: 你和漢斯一起出去坐在露台上，這時花店老闆走了過來，她要見伊娃。

src: A memory comes to him then, one so strong it could have happened yesterday.
mt: 他腦海中又浮現出一絲鮮明的記憶，就像是昨天剛發生的。

src: He reaches a supermarket with aisles full of sugary foods and bored-looking people.
mt: 他又走到一家超市，那裡有好幾條通道，擺滿了琳琅滿目的含糖食物，到處是無所事事的人。

src: Nurse Hamilton sits in the interrogation room with Jerry, the two of them alone while others outside discuss his future.
mt: 漢密爾頓護士與傑瑞坐在審訊室里，其他人則在外面討論著他的未來。

src: He could see a million stars, and looking out at them made the night feel timeless, it made him feel tiny.
mt: 百萬顆星星彷彿讓今夜化作永恆，看著它們，讓他覺得自己無比渺小。

src: She marched towards you. She looked at the gun, then she took in the plastic bags and the tarpaulin and the horror of it all struck her and actually brought her to a stop. Her expression changed from one of relief to one of horror.
mt: 她大步向你走來，看了看槍，撿起塑料袋和防水帆布，恐懼攫住了她，讓她停下手，表情從釋然變成恐懼。

src: There was knocking from the front door a few times that you ignored.
mt: 前門響了好幾次敲門聲，你都置之不理。

src: We go and make Gary tell us where it is?
mt: 咱們先去找加里，讓他說出它在哪裡？

src: I’ll have to drive around for a bit to make sure I’m not being tailed, but hopefully I’ll be there in an hour or two.
mt: 我得開車繞道，以確保我不被跟蹤，但我估計我會在一兩個小時後到那裡。

src: There is a pause in the crowd as people try to interpret what Jerry just said.
mt: 人們都在想怎麼解讀傑瑞剛才說的話。

src: And there you are, walking up to the stage.
mt: 看啊，你走上舞台。

src: A moment later the needle of the syringe punctures Jerry’s arm. Something warm floods his body, making him immediately tired. His body becomes heavy.
mt: 片刻之後，注射器刺進傑瑞的手臂，他的身體里湧起一股暖流，一股突如其來的疲倦在體內擴散，他覺得昏昏沉沉的。

src: There’s not, you said.
mt: 「沒有。」你說。

src: They sit down. The TV is on, and the news is on, and the news anchors are talking about a woman who was murdered yesterday, a really beautiful woman with long blond hair that reminds him a little of Sandra. There’s a gold four-leaf clover hanging on a chain around her neck, which isn’t something Sandra would wear.

src: “Don’t put this on me,” Jerry says.

src: He’s reading a newspaper, on the front page of which is a woman he recognizes. The woman’s name is Laura Hunt, and Laura was murdered inside her house.
mt: 他正閱讀一份報紙，頭版刊登著一個女人的照片，他記得這個叫勞拉·亨特的女人，她在自己的家中被人殺害了。

src: They all know what happened here, they all played a part in Sandra’s death, and they’re trying to trick him into believing he did it.
mt: 他們都知道這裏發生過什麼，桑德拉的死他們都有份兒，他們想欺騙他，讓他相信是他自己乾的。

src: “I don’t know, but I imagine I would have.”
mt: 「我不知道，但我想我會。」

src: “To the nursing home.”
mt: 「回療養院。」

src: Nurse Hamilton asks.
mt: 漢密爾頓護士問。

src: If you had killed her before then, Mae would have seen the blood on your shirt.
mt: 如果你在那之前就殺害了她，那麼梅將會看到你襯衫上的血跡。

src: Ha funny.
mt: 「哈哈，有趣。」

src: “Talk,” he says.
mt: 「說吧。」

src: He takes his seat belt off and twists in his seat so he can face Jerry.
mt: 他鬆開安全帶，在座位上扭過身來，這樣他就可以面對傑瑞了。

src: Henry isn’t a real person, and you’ve never seen him as such, but that hasn’t stopped him from making small talk.
mt: 亨利並不是真實存在的人，你也從來沒見過他，但是這並不妨礙你跟他閑聊。

src: Hans shakes his head. Then he sighs. Then he looks at his watch and then he shifts a little on the stool.
mt: 漢斯搖搖頭，嘆了口氣，接著看了看自己的手錶，在凳子上來回晃動了一下。

src: I checked the laundry and it’s not there.
mt: 我找遍了洗衣間，它不在那裡。

src: “It’s going to be okay,” the orderly says, and why do people keep insisting on that?
mt: 「都會好的。」護理員說，人們為什麼會這樣堅信著呢？

src: I asked her what you were wearing, and she said the same clothes from the wedding, from the online video.
mt: 我問她，你當時穿著什麼，她說是參加婚禮的那套衣服，錄在線視頻時穿的那套衣服。

src: “And what if he didn’t?”
mt: 「萬一他沒有呢？」

src: So you’re fascinated by crime.
mt: 「所以，犯罪總是令你痴迷不已。」

src: “She didn’t even wake up.
mt: 「她甚至沒有醒。

src: I just find it strange that Mrs. Blatch says she was sure it was you, and that she thought you were doing some gardening.
mt: 「我只是覺得奇怪，布拉奇太太說她確信那人是你，她以為你在打理花園來著。」

src: Let me think,” Jerry says, and he takes a few deep breaths and he tries to push thoughts of Sandra aside and focus on today.
mt: 好吧，讓我想想。」傑瑞說。他做了幾次深呼吸，想先把桑德拉的事放在一邊，專心致志地想今天的事。

src: Now I’m more clearheaded than I’ve been in a long time.
mt: 現在我的頭腦比以往任何時候都清醒。

src: “Okay, then we don’t need to worry about her getting cold because they’ll be on their way.”
mt: 「好吧，那麼我們不必擔心她會挨凍了，因為他們正在來的路上。」

src: I don’t mean in the books, I mean in real life.”
mt: 我的意思不是說在書里，而是在現實生活中。」

src: More people were showing up, and Rick and his entourage went into the church and you stayed outside with Hans.
mt: 越來越多的人到了。瑞克一行走進教堂，你和漢斯則留在了外面。

src: and couldn’t remember Sandra’s name.
mt: 卻忽然記不得桑德拉的名字了。

src: “I am calm,” he tells her, and he taps the side of his head and it reminds him of a table his parents used to have.
mt: 「我很冷靜。」他告訴她，又用手拍了一下頭，這又讓他想起他父母曾經用過的那張桌子。

src: Good news—Nicholas is going to save your manuscript. You’re sure of it, and the book will be out next year.
mt: 好消息：尼古拉斯拯救了你的手稿，你有把握小說會在明年出版。

src: “Jerry, we really must be going,” Nurse Hamilton says.
mt: 「傑瑞，我們真的必須走了。」漢密爾頓護士說。

src: They’re installing alarms, Future Jerry. Can you believe that?
mt: 未來的傑瑞，他們正在安裝警報器，你能相信嗎？

src: His friend was in a state somewhere between consciousness and sleep. He allowed Hans to lead him to the house.
mt: 他的朋友處於半夢半醒的狀態，漢斯領著他向家裡走去。

src: Funny how you could remember that sentiment from a book you read more than ten years ago, but can’t find your car keys.
mt: 你還能記得十幾年前讀過的書本中的觀點，卻找不到車鑰匙，這真是滑稽。

src: Are you deliberately being stupid?
mt: 你在故意裝蠢？」

src: Was Henry more than just a pen name?
mt: 亨利真的只是個筆名嗎？

src: Following entries find Past Jerry confessing to more crimes from his books: a couple of homicides, a bank robbery, a kidnapping, even to being a drug dealer.
mt: 在下面的篇目中，「過去的傑瑞」承認了更多他書中描繪過的罪行：兇殺、搶劫、綁架，乃至販毒。

src: But before you head to church to confess, just remember what he did.
mt: 在你去教堂懺悔之前，只需要記得他做了什麼。

src: Jerry?
mt: 「傑瑞？」

src: “In real life?”
mt: 「在真實生活中嗎？」

src: You said very little to each other.
mt: 你們彼此很少說話。

src: “Umm . . .” Terrance says, and then looks to Nurse Hamilton.
mt: 「嗯……」特倫斯說，然後盯著漢密爾頓護士。

src: And wasn’t it exciting?
mt: 是不是很刺激？

src: Jerry lets him think. He can’t remember this morning, but he can remember that Hans likes to really think things through.
mt: 傑瑞看著他凝神思考，他不記得今天早上發生的事，但他記得漢斯喜歡探究事情的來龍去脈。

src: You were picturing the whole cycle again, watching the news, waiting for the phone call, waiting to see who else was dead.
mt: 你再次回顧了事情的整個過程，看新聞，等電話，等著看還有誰死了。

src: It was the same day Laura Hunt was killed.”
mt: 當天，勞拉·亨特就被人殺害了。」

src: “You son of—”
mt: 「你這個渾蛋——」

src: She looked at the trash bags, the tarpaulin, and she started to cry.
mt: 桑德拉看著垃圾袋、防水帆布，哭了起來。

src: Past Jerry is found once again wandering in town, and when he’s taken back to the nursing home he finds another piece of jewelry in his pocket, and he has no memory of how he left the home.
mt: 「過去的傑瑞」再次被發現在城裡遊盪，他被帶回療養院，他在口袋裡發現了另一件首飾，但他不記得是如何離開療養院的。

src: An author, you idiot.
mt: 「作家，你這個白痴。」

src: Please. Will you help me?”
mt: 拜託，幫幫我，好嗎？」

src: “I do,” Eva said, and the crowd was smiling and some, like Eva’s mother, were weeping.
mt: 「我願意。」伊娃說，眾人都開心地笑了，而有些人，比如伊娃的母親，卻忍不住哭了。

src: “Dead.”
mt: 「死了？」

src: “And there’s no doubt in your mind?”
mt: 「你心中就沒有一絲疑慮嗎？」

src: “Yeah, yeah, of course.
mt: 「是的，是的，當然知道。

src: You just couldn’t.
mt: 你只是不能。

src: “There is something that has been bothering me about this all along,” he says.
mt: 「這段時間，有些事一直困擾著我。」

src: Jerry thinks about it.
mt: 傑瑞陷入沉思。

src: “And what reason would that be?”
mt: 「出於什麼原因呢？」

src: If that’s true, if there is a chance of getting better, then I need to do what I can to make that happen.
mt: 如果真的能有機會讓一切變得更美好，那麼我只需要做到力所能及的事就好。

src: The garage windows have been covered with pieces of cardboard taped into place.

src: “Sometimes you get confused about what is real and what you made up.

src: “Not the last one.”

src: Good news—the alarms mean Sandra isn’t planning on putting you into a care facility right away.
mt: 好消息：安裝警報器意味著桑德拉不會馬上把你送進療養院。

src: “Surveillance from the mall is going to find you going into the bathroom, and they’re going to run the footage in both directions and find out where you came from and where you went.
mt: 「他們會調看商場監控錄像，會發現你走進廁所，他們會查看兩個方向的畫面，弄清楚你從哪裡來，又去了哪裡。

src: He’s not asked any more questions because his answers can’t be considered relevant.
mt: 他們沒有問他任何問題，因為他的回答都會被視為與案件無關。

src: Christ, she has NO IDEA how this feels. She isn’t THE ONE who is suffering, she isn’t THE ONE who is losing her mind.
mt: 天啊，她根本就不知道那是一種怎樣的感覺，她又不是受苦的那個，她又不是失憶的那個。

src: Your novels, are they like that?”
mt: 你的小說都是這種嗎？」

src: To Gary, I like what you’ve done with the place.

src: Jerry looks at the gun. Then he thinks about the knife on the desk and has to make a conscious effort not to look in its direction.
mt: 傑瑞看著槍，他想起了桌上的刀，他必須有意識地控制住自己，不要朝那個方向看。

src: Bad news—you’re probably in your final few days at home now.

src: His name is Jerry Henry Grey Cutter and he is an author and he makes things up and he’s making this up. This isn’t real. These people aren’t real.
mt: 他的名字是傑瑞·亨利·格雷·卡特，他是位作家，他虛構故事，這些都是他虛構的，這些都不是真的，這些人都不是真的。

src: Hans dials Eva’s number as they walk back through the house.

src: Jerry remembers that day.

src: He flicks through the pages of the book Eva handed him, but not looking at any of the words.

src: God loves everybody—but even he thinks this shmuck is an asswhole.

src: You weren’t up for an argument, so you told her you were clear on that.

src: Jerry has always known this day was coming, the day of confession. He just hopes it comes with absolution.

src: “What if the journal clears me?

src: He said he had asked you about it at the time, but you had no answer.

src: You sat in the lounge with your arm around Sandra and listened to Eva sing, and Rick sat watching her and he was mesmerized, and you don’t think you’ve ever seen a guy as in love as good ol’ Rick.
mt: 你坐在客廳的沙發上，摟著桑德拉，聽著伊娃唱歌，瑞克坐在那兒心醉神迷地看著伊娃，你從未見過有誰像瑞克這樣痴情。

src: Come back when you get a warrant.”

src: Jerry studies his face, his features, looking for recognition and understanding, but all he sees is fear and uncertainty.
mt: 傑瑞端詳著他的臉，審視著他的表情，想尋找他的認可和理解，但他所看到的只是恐懼和迷茫。

src: Hans pointed out. I can sneak out the windows.

src: You went wandering again today, and because of that Sandra considered keeping you in tonight and not sending you on the bachelor’s party.

src: “I could feel her breath on my hand, and her eyes . . . her eyes were wide and terrified and made me feel—”

src: That I killed her?

src: Jerry thinks about what he just said and figures out where he went wrong.

src: Hans flicks on a light.

src: It was not long before you met Sandra.

src: It’s possible you never even bought one.

mt: 我出來接你時，發現我把裝刀和毛巾的塑料袋落在廁所里了。」

src: “Which one?”

src: He yawns again, then suddenly snaps awake, unaware he was starting to doze.

src: Mayor asks. “You remember killing them. Is that why you write?

src: Huh?” He punches the steering wheel. “You stupid moron.”

src: “We know you killed the girls,” Hans says, and Eric looks confused, or at least is trying to look confused.

src: You’ve lost count how many times she’s said over the last week You can’t do that, Jerry, or You should be doing that, Jerry.

src: It’s because I love your books, man, he said.

src: He turns left and runs like Hans told him to.

src: You called Hans. You told him everything about the shirt, the knife, the blood.

src: The words aren’t his, but he knows who they belong to.

src: He realizes his mind has once again gone wandering.

src: “Of course I injected you!

src: “She’s going to come inside, and I bet she’s called the police.

src: “Put your palms flat on the desk,” Hans says.

src: “You’ll need to speak to the nursing home,” the officer says, “tell them this kind of thing can’t keep happening.”
mt: 「你得跟療養院商量一下。」警察說，「讓他們保證這種事情不再發生。」

src: He misses his wife and he misses his life and he just wants to hit the big reset button and have it all back.

src: From the lounge there’s a sliding door to the backyard.

src: She didn’t look as unhappy as you’d have thought.

src: Sometimes I have questions, and sometimes the doctors answer them, and sometimes I don’t believe what I’m hearing, and sometimes to prove their point they’ll show me a copy of the confession note I wrote.
mt: 有時我會問一些問題，醫生偶爾會回答；有時我不相信我親耳聽到的，為了證明他們的觀點，他們會給我看我寫的懺悔書。

src: Hans asks.
mt: 漢斯說。

src: Jerry puts down the toy. He walks over to his desk and runs his fingers along the edge of it.

src: Though, for the life of him, he can’t remember the pin code for the safe and, come to think of it, where is the safe?
mt: 不過，他也總是記不住保險箱的密碼，話說回來，保險箱又在哪兒？
